Reviews.Title: “"Worth the Price"”
Reviews.Author: Phillip A
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been staying at the Plim for 8 years atleast. Yes it is a bit dated and can use some fix ups but I am on Vacation for the ocean and other activities not to be in the hotel room all day. First off location is spot on can't get no closer to what you want to do. Second the pool and outside bar is one unlike any other. Even the food is good and affordable. I will stay here every year without hesitation. If you don't get parking at the hotel then yes you half to walk a block up the street to your car maybe 1 1/2 min "No big Deal" If you stay here expect the hallway and rooms to be older and a bit dated but like i said i am not on vacation to stay in the room all day, just to sleep. My parents stayed her for their first time and really enjoyed themselves. Especially the outside pool area with the bands.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Rooms”
Reviews.Author: SimonUA
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Plim Plaza. The first room was everything but smoke-free to the point where we needed to request another room, so that we would not get nauseous. The second room strongly smelled off cleaners and the carpet was wet in a large area. The room itself was not entirely clean. We did not look for a Hilton (although we could have stayed at one in other parts of the country for the price the Plim Plaza charged), but we did expect a clean and sanitary room. The only positive is the location to the boardwalk which can hardly be topped.

Reviews.Title: “Please save your money...”
Reviews.Author: Mark H
Reviews.Content: I just brought my daughter to OC for a few days as a birthday present and we stayed here, most likely the biggest mistake of this vacation! Terrible to below average service at best, the place simply REEKED to high heaven of mold or mildew and that doesn't even include the fact that the stench from the smokers floors seeped to every corner of the hotel. Carpets were just freakin' filthy, there were black mildew stains on the ceiling of the shower, the toilet was almost falling out of place, wallpaper was peeling, air conditioner didn't work properly (our clothes and magazines/books actually became MORE wet in the room than they did in the car), bathroom vent fan was blown, etc, etc... The "double" room was so small that I could almost do a standing broad jump from the door to the window, I was actually impressed that they could fit two double beds in there. Even the cheapest of double rooms I've stayed at before have had space for a table and two chairs, this place only had one chair stuffed into a corner and that was only there to cover up an unfinished wall panel. If the normal status of the hotel is this bad, then please DO NOT try to get ice from any of the machines (even if you can find one that works), there is no doubt what-so-ever that the machine is filled with bacteria and filth and doesn't meet health standards. I've stayed in so many hotels over my life that I can't even count, but if you listen to the folks that say that this place is "perfect for R&R" or a "great value" or "perfect for family" then you are being misled by folks who simply don't know any better. For these people to call this place a "Resort" hotel is beyond understanding. If you want to stay here then roll the dice, but I would say to just stay away...

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: Meg52787
Reviews.Content: Well I can't say it was the best place I have ever stayed but it wasn't too bad. The location was great in terms of being close to everything. I could have done without the noise. But then again, I chose it knowing that there was a bar on site. The room was clean however it needed some renovations done. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They allowed us to check-in almost 4 hours early. I would stay again if I didn't have the kids with us and if they do some renovations.

Reviews.Title: “What did I pay for!?”
Reviews.Author: Kmbmjo
Reviews.Content: The lady at the front desk was not helpful at all. Very bad attitude. Once I finally got to the room I looked out the window and clearly there was no pool! ( I booked the pool view room) I went back to the front desk and the woman walked away right away, the man then told me that I had to be "bumped" to another room. Clearly no communication skills. I will NEVER recommend this place to anyone. It was in a good location though :)

Reviews.Title: “Not the best!”
Reviews.Author: Constant H
Reviews.Content: The Plim is a old hotel in need of many renovations. We have stayed at the Plim many times and it only seems to get worse. Smells bad, not always clean and the walls are paper thin. The rooms that front the pool are very bad choice as the noise is bad and the band quite loud. Why did we stay there you ask. Prices are about the lowest on the boardwalk. We don't stay in our room much as we are on the go. They do have a spacious lobby, a great pool, and the front porch is large and kept quite clean for the amount of traffic. Location is also good as it close to most everything. So if your not in your room much and don't mind the noise factor its not bad. I have now chosen to stay elsewhere at one of the newer places. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Taj Mahal, but a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sue V
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for vacation, and would have to disagree with some of the reviews that I've read. Yes the rooms are small, but they were clean and odor free, our room had no peeling wallpaper, the windows worked, and the beds were free from bed bugs! The bathroom is on the small side, but how much time or space do you need to shower or use the restroom?! Had no problem with the staff, all were friendly and helpful! Parking is limited at the hotel, but it's just two short blocks to their other lot. I can't complain about the price either, for a hotel right on the boardwalk with all it offers (pool, 3 hot tubs, and bar/restaurant on premises) it was a great rate. It's not a 5 star hotel, but it's not a dive either.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, dumpy rooms”
Reviews.Author: joemacg
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small and very outdated. Everything stays damp in the room. Bathrooms are very small. Staff is not very friendly. The good part of the hotel is the location and the pool bar. The entertainment is a nice way to end the day by hanging out at a nice pool bar and a large pool.

Reviews.Title: “For Me to Poop On”
Reviews.Author: Casey H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just one day what I payed for this hotel was not worth the amount I payed at all. Our towels in the bathroom weren't clean and we found hair on them. Our floors were damp and felt wet, and also the toilet in the bathroom didn't work at all properly. Even our fridge was broken I couldn't open it all the way. The room was tiny and the beds were small. One who stays here also wouldn't get many condiments either their was only one shampoo and we only had two towels and a few wash cloths, and people should know most good hotels have a shampoo, conditioner, lotion, body wash, and a lot more to satisfy your needs. We did have a nice outside patio facing the boardwalk although our back door to get there was busted and hard to swing open which was pissified. The elevators inside the place looked old and rusty like they wouldn't work and the hall ways looked like something out of a dirty venue. The staff when we checked in were at least nice. The worst is my female friend had bites while waking up which we believe the beds may of had sand mites, or dust mites or weren't very clean. All in all this place can blow and I will never stay here again. It's terrible. Oh even the jacuzzis you expect to be pretty well heated but it felt as of semi-heat.

Reviews.Title: “Skip the bad reviews!!!”
Reviews.Author: chellenels
Reviews.Content: Skip the bad reviews. I was scared reading these before going. This isnt a 5 star hotel but it is clean and comfortable and a great value for the money. The pool is great along with the outdoor bar and plenty of seating both by the pool and the boardwalk. The hotel is in a great location and near the pier. The rooms were a little small, but you are not in Ocean City to sit in your room. Had a great time and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice & clean”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer H
Reviews.Content: We just came back from the Plim Plaza (stayed week of August 13,2012). Let me just start by saying I am picky but not too picky. I have stayed in beautiful resorts (Hyatt's, Hilton's, Marriotts & more) and I have stayed in dive motels. I would say this is an average/decent hotel. Cleanliness is #1 to me. Our room was VERY clean & the bathroom was spotless and completely remodeled which was really nice!! The rooms are small but we had "communication rooms" that were joined together by a decent size hallway, closet and bathroom. This made for more room for our toddler to run around in!! The lobby & entrance is very clean & nicely remodeled. The front porch was nice to sit at in the evenings & it wasn't "packed with smokers" like other reviews have stated (I'm a non-smoker myself). The AC's worked great & our rooms stayed very cool. The hallways are worn-down BUT it seems that PP is slowly remodeling everything & with a large hotel that takes time. I peeked in other rooms on the 3rd floor while walking by & they were remodeled as well with new baths & also looked very clean. The Pool & Hot Tubs were sparkling!! Just wish they stayed open later (for the adults) because the Pool Bar did. Staff was all very helpful & friendly. Hallway was loud but we brought a "sound machine" with us to drowned at the noise. We do this on every vacation though because 9 out of 10 hotels are too noisey for me!!

Reviews.Title: “YOU WORK HARD FOR YOUR MONEY DO NOT GIVE IT TO THIS PLACE”
Reviews.Author: scott s
Reviews.Content: I am not going to sugar coat this. This place is a total dive and its one good quality of being on the beach is so over rated. If you have the nerve to charge top rates for a hotel then you should run it like one. the check in staff was very unprofessional. they made it a point to let you know from the second you check in that there are no refunds ( as per the big sign at the check in ) and too bad if you are unhappy about having to park your car over 2 blocks away. yes they had very little parking like 20 spots and everyone else had to park 2 blocks or better away in a unsecure lot with no one watching out for you. the halls were so small ( very narrow ) and smelled bad all the time. the rooms had very uneven floors and I mean uneven. the wall paper or lack there of was coming off the walls in just about every direction you turned your head. the bath rooms were so tiny if you measure from your elbow to your finger tips and add about six inches that would give you the amount of space you had to use the toilet. ( that is no lie ) . please do not be mislead by the pictures or the other reviews posted on here that paint a beautiful picture of a great place that you have to come stay at. I have never been to ocean city before. and if I ever go back one thing is certain I will never stay there I dont care if they knock it down and rebuild it (which it desprately needs ). this hotel has a lot of nerve stealing money from honest hard working families. this hotel is a total rip off please do your home work and dont get taken advantage of like so many before you. my review is honest and to the point and like I said I am not going to sugar coat it. its your money and you work hard for it. please dont let these thieves take it from you.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel awesome location!!”
Reviews.Author: Lppcmom
Reviews.Content: Yes the hotel is old. Yes the rooms could use some updating. The service is friendly. The view and location is the best on the boardwalk. The pool and hot tub is clean. Yes there is sand. You're at the beach- there's gonna b sand every where- including the bath tub. But the water pressure in shower is the best I've ever had in any hotel EVER - perfect after a day in the ocean. The pool during the day is total party time- great music- great variety. We had such a great time there- planning on returning next year for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but great location!”
Reviews.Author: Don H
Reviews.Content: Yes, the rooms are that small. The whole place had a musty smell. Could smell pot in the hallway. The place is old, but updated. Bed was ok, but this isn't the high rent district. I didn't feel real safe, but had no issues at all. There is a heavy police presence in OC and they react very fast to any problems, very reassuring, but still I left iPad, DSLR's and valuables in the truck. On the plus side, the free coffee was excellent, the best I had in OC! The place is right on the Boardwalk at 2nd Street. Comfortable front porch with lots of rocking chairs and tables. Huge pool and great bar, live bands too. Fresh fruit and daily newspaper was available at the front desk. Staff was friendly. The room was clean, but like I said, the place had a musty smell. We only slept there, spending most of the time on the Boardwalk, which was everything you would expect, lots to see and do. Parking was tight, but we always found a space either at the hotel or at the overflow lot a short walk from the hotel. Spectacular sunrises and sunsets. Oh, one last thing, The Paul Revere Buffet at Plim Plaza was freak'n awesome, best food on the beach! Cute Irish waitress too! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a cheaprooms.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. The food at the outside bar is good. The service is good. Room was clean. Staff was friendly. We would stay again but would hope to get a better rate. Staying right on the boardwalk at 2nd avenue was really cool. The location is awesome. Lots of good food and entertainment close by. Ask the bartenders at the pool bar for the hot places to go for nightly fun.

Reviews.Title: “Love the location...rooms & staff need lots of help”
Reviews.Author: C G
Reviews.Content: First.... positive review.... great location, very nice pool and bar/restaurant and their staff. But...negative.... rooms and hallways need updates.... now. We've been going to this hotel for the last 32 years and the rooms and carpets still look the same.... are you kidding?? And, this time my daughter's room's bathroom door had been trimmed (for whatever reason) and when you closed it, there was still a 1 inch crack from top to bottom where you could have a toilet view into the bathroom. The cleaning staff did do their best to keep the rooms clean and brought us fresh towels every time we asked. .... We love going back to this hotel..... but I hope the Plim Plaza owner reads this review and gets with some remodeling... btw, we have oceanfront with porch rooms.... cost more and should be updated now!! Oh yes and the tall maintenance person with the ponytail definitely needs to get a job where he doesn't have to deal with people.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place”
Reviews.Author: Kim D
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to Plim Plaza this past weekend. I was leery before I went after reading all the bad reviews, but it wasn't a bad place. Yes, the rooms were small but who is in their room that long. I have stayed at other hotels in Ocean City that were alot worse! The hotel and rooms were clean, the pool and bar was great!! I had no problems with parking and I thought the staff was friendly and great! Also, the location is excellent! I would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Met my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Bells4family
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small and dated as I expected, but clean. Lots of water pressure in the shower. Location is hard to beat. On the boardwalk and only a 5 minute walk to the pier. Parking is limited at the hotel but the overflow is only 1.5 small blocks away. The pool area and bar were wonderful. Great bar food, good prices, and a fun atmosphere with the live music. Best value of food that we found in Ocean City was at the Paul Revere restaurant in the basemest of the hotel. Very fun place. Will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very rude staff”
Reviews.Author: gretchen2008
Reviews.Content: stayed here in the middle of july.The location is the only thing that was good about this hotel. the staff were the rudest people I've ever dealt with. The maids give you a nasty look when you walk by so I chose not to have my room serviced. I asked for an extra towel and I got a nasty look after I was polite and said "thank you" so I ran out to the grocery store to buy my own toilet paper and towels. room smelled like smoke. the room was clean when I arrived. the hotel in all needs updated, it's very old looking. parking is okay. you have to walk a couple blocks but that's not bad. would probably not stay again because of the experience with staff.

Reviews.Title: “Plim Plaza the 4th July week”
Reviews.Author: loosegoose76
Reviews.Content: I stay there the week of the 2 July -6 July I wasn't sure on what to expect went I got there ,because I read the reviews and was wondering if I made the right choice or not , but my room was cleaned every day and vacum clean sheets and towels I had a porch room , you have to understand it's not the Hilton , they have one of the biggest pool in o.c.and a good pool bar but after all if you want the Hilton you pay for the Hilton and its in wakling distance of it all I would go back again ,I sleep in a tent for 6 months so its not that bad

Reviews.Title: “tony / pa”
Reviews.Author: anthony f
Reviews.Content: well after reading other reviews i'm sure many must of stayed at nice places for the money.. let me start with this... the carpets r dirty, the halls stink, the rooms r small an dirty.. the toliet barely flushed, the hot water in the shower would go cold then super hotel back an forth on it's own.. the first night we had to leave the hotel cause it rained an the ceiling fell in someones room an water was leaking through the 5th floor hallway lights an ceiling.. the wall paper an carpet is way out dated an needs to b fixed. the room wall paper was coming off... the staff was nice though, an the pool an the tiki bar area, an thats the only thing that makes this hotel.... i would never stay again for the price u can go find much nicer one then this..... sorry plim, u need to take care of ur hotel.... below it say fitness center... i never saw one

Reviews.Title: “Felt like I needed a tetanus shot after staying here”
Reviews.Author: cld1450
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Plim Plaza for the 4th of July. It was cheap and I was afraid to reserve a room, but the reviews I read didn't seem too bad and we were only going to be in our room to sleep so we decided to take a chance.....what a mistake! It was dirty and run down. I can deal with old furnishings and a place needing work, but I wanted to burn my clothes after staying there. We honestly considered sleeping in the car. It may be okay for some, I found it completely disgusting and wouldn't stay there for $50 per night. I would have rather slept in a tent!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: beachgi
Reviews.Content: I stayed there back in 2008 with wife and young daughter and only reason didn't return yet because of money issues and other circumstances. Will be soon heading back in couple of days. Love the pool,poolside bar,bands,hot tubs. People are to picky,this place is right on boardwalk close to everything. Rather spend money on a good time then waste all for a place to shower and lay my head.

Reviews.Title: “Plim rooms updated”
Reviews.Author: bsg5698
Reviews.Content: Last week while at the Pool Bar I decided to take a walk through the halls. (yes. really no security) Anyway these are my observations. The first thing I noticed is the hall wallpaper has been replaced, the carpet looked clean, there was no smell in the halls. The room have computerized entrance passes rather than a key. There is a new glass elevator that over looks THREE hot tubs and the pool. I looked in 2 of the rooms. Yes they are small, but it is an old hotel. The headboards and bedspreads LOOK new. The only thing I did not see were the bathrooms which I doubt have been updated because the nightly rates would skyrocket. For a short stay they really looked OK! Location location location!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, value, decent hotel.... Will be back the week of July 20th 2012! Woohoo....”
Reviews.Author: Lovenowtravel
Reviews.Content: All I can say is that I stayed here on summer 2011 with family & we had a great time. Room was clean, free of bugs, good AC temperature. Love the location across the beach & close to restaurants & shops. Sorry for the other people but I had a great stay. Friendly staff & just a right place to sleep after a day at the beach. Nothing fancy just a simple hotel who offered me a safe place to sleep. Love it so much that I'm back at the end of July 2012. :). Thanks Plim!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, dumpy accomodation”
Reviews.Author: GreekFood13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on a recent Saturday night. There are so many things right with this hotel, and a few things just plain wrong. The right: friendly staff, live-in parrot, and the pool bar is the best in OC. The room was also very cold and the AC worked great. The wrong: the room and everything in it. Although I think our room was clean, and the cleaning staff makes an effort, the wallpaper was peeling and discolored, the curtains and bedspread were dingy, and the bathroom looked dirty, with black marks all over the tile. Every single thing in this place was outdated and past retirement. For what we paid to stay there for just one night, you'd think they could afford some minor updates, like a coat of paint. Bottom line, this is an old hotel with small, dingy rooms. But the location can't be beat, and I could spend many lazy days at the pool bar, people-watching and enjoying the live bands.

Reviews.Title: “Get Over Yourself”
Reviews.Author: Catherine H
Reviews.Content: I am so sick of seeing people talking about bed-bugs and sand fleas. If you roll or play in leaves you could possibly get what? TICKS! If you roll and play in sand you could possibly get what? SAND FLEAS! alright so if plim plaza had bed-bugs they'd be what? SHUT DOWN! . . . please think people

Reviews.Title: “The Plim Plaza is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Pookie-Duke
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed at the Plim Plaza since the '50' s. We still have our annual summer family reunion there. It is one of the older hotels, so don't expect frilly rooms. (old but clean) Why stay at the Plim: Location is great, a porch with Bermuda chairs with an awesome ocean view, the Plim boardwalk web cam to communicate with family back home (behave bc they can see you up and down the boardwalk And on the beach) HAH, the sand sculptors are right there (front row seat) their Paul Rever Smorgasbord, meal deal packages, huge pool (servers), live pool-side music, lobby has internet, morning goodies, newspaper (free) a young mature staff that are so helpful and really great rates in September before they close. Who knows... We might just see you there! =+}

Reviews.Title: “Very Disapointed!!!! Overpriced+”
Reviews.Author: 399Pat
Reviews.Content: This was a family trip/anniversary celebration. The location was unbeatable!Right on the boardwalk We stayed from fri to mon. Everyone enjoyed the pool, the onsite bar and resturant. However.......the rooms are smaller that any I have ever stayed in. Our room was on the pool side over the club. Music was very loud. The room had a bed, dresser with microwave and fridge. Bedside tables with NO lamps. No chair to sit in. I asked about the lamps and was told that the room did not come with lamps. I was given a chair (after asking) from the lobby which was so badly stained that I placed a towel on the seat, before I would sit on it. The internet was available in the lobby. (My son could not use his laptop in the room because there was no desk). The chair at the desk with the computer was old and the seat was torn up like something from a trash heap. The parrot in the lobby was cute, but it pooped on newspaper on the floor. This hotel really takes advantage of it's location with lack of services and it needs cleaning. the furniture and carpeting is filthy! Not worth 189.00/more like 39.00. Never coming back. Saving grace: Very courteous and accomodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, except...”
Reviews.Author: Mike C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here specifically because it looked out over the sand sculptures. The room was nice- looked like it had recently been redone. Only problems were there was no desk / table, and the single chair was literally crammed between the bed and the wall. We stayed on the 5th floor; it was very quiet in the hotel itself, and as we had a rook overlooking the boardwalk, there wasn't much outside noise either.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place”
Reviews.Author: Kristie L
Reviews.Content: Before visiting the Plim I was scared because of some of the bad reviews on here. Ignore them, our room was totally redone. Nicest place we could have stayed, the room even smelled new. The staff was very nice and helpful. Best pool bar area ever! The servers will come right up to you and serve you while your lounging. Perfect location! I would recommend to anyone! And will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Katie A
Reviews.Content: three of my friends and I just got back from OC this evening and we stayed at the plim thursday to monday and we just absolutely loved this hotel! we got to stay on the boardwalk with a smoking room for four nights and paid less then we would have at an off the boardwalk hotel! we had a beautiful ocean view with the pool and bar connected to the back of the hotel! we are all 30 years old and stayed over a senior week weekend, and the windows were nice and sound proof. plus the staff was wonderful and made us feel so comfortable. the rooms could use a little updating, but if you are that worried about your room when your on vacation, then its just a waste. for the price, location and friendliness we WILL be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “2012 stay”
Reviews.Author: memehazel
Reviews.Content: we were at the Plim, May 28 thru June 2 2012. We know they put a lot of money into repairs because one could see them. Our room had been redone , new paper, new bathroom tub lining, new service center, refrig and micro in room, nice touch. no more going to the lobby to heat any food. Soda machine - still 40 cents

Reviews.Title: “don't stay in the dungeon”
Reviews.Author: stacey m
Reviews.Content: Been staying here for the past 3 yrs!!! the first yr. we stayed pool side which was a great view and could hear the live music..loved the pool and the hot tubs!!! wasnt pleased about the seating outfront on the boardwalk seats were always full!!! last year was not PLEASED at all got stuck in was seemed like a dungeon..when u looked out the windows all you seen was a brick wall!!! Not to mention went to the beach and came back to the room to find 2 maids in our bathroom using our hairspray and combs to do there own hair..wtf!!! ewww.. I think the best part about this hotel is the parrot and how close it is to the boardwalk and ocean!!! think this place needs some major upgrades!!! would bring alot more people in if the rooms were bigger and cleaner just sayin...........

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there years ago and never went back”
Reviews.Author: TerryandKathy
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the Plim Plaza aprox.12 summers ago and never went back until I went to the beach over Memorial Day and my co-worker was staying there and I met her at the bar/restaurant they have there. She and her boyfriend were staying there and were very upset over how disgusting and dirty the room was. I told her I wish I knew she was staying there I would of warned her! We all went up and checked out the room and it was as I remembered only alot worse. Paint peeling off, dirty smelling, mold in bathroom, for God's sake how are they passing inspections? They need to tear it down and start over! Great location but don't let that fool you. Been going to OC for over 20 years shop around many decent clean hotels close to the boardwalk. Don't take the risk of getting sick.

Reviews.Title: “Held my breath in all common areas”
Reviews.Author: PKM99
Reviews.Content: Great location, but will not stay there again until improvements are complete. The smell in the hallway was a rancid combination of Final Net Hair Spray (from the 70’s), Old English, Mold, Body Odor and Heat. Although they were making improvements to the pool deck, they were patching carpet in the hallway which implies the smells are there to stay. The first thing I did in the room was clean dried toothpaste off of the metal shelf. The cleaning staff was friendly, but do not understand common courtesy. One morning at 8am, we were awakened by a maintenance man talking very loudly on his cell phone while he paced up and down the hallway. Another day, I was walking behind a cleaning person who walked very slowly. She would not speak nor allow me to pass her. Cushions on lobby furniture were stained and the furniture did not match. The beautiful front porch is full of cigarette smoke...all day long. The room was tiny, but had new windows, new shower insert and tile, new carpet (although dirty), good A/C and the configuration of closets and bathrooms insulated it from adjacent room noise. The staff was super sweet, and we met several nice people in the lobby area. You have a great location, dedicated staff, and guests who would pay a bit more if changes were made: I recommend - replacement of all hallway materials, no-smoking enforcement on front and back porch, new sheets that fit snuggly to the bed (slide off when you turn and expose you to mattress), train cleaning and maintenance staff on hospitality, reward front desk staff for hospitality, enforce a uniform (matching shirts for all staff), offer discount coupon to guests for food or drink at your pool bar to encourage use. Replace the furniture in lobby with quality materials that match - to encourage use. You are doing a lot of things right, and I wish you well.

Reviews.Title: “this place needs to be condemned”
Reviews.Author: drube77
Reviews.Content: we have stayed a few times for my wife's family get togethers and while the staff is very nice the rooms are horrendous . Our last stay we spent the extra money to get a porch room hoping it was in better condition than the rest of the place , it wasnt .The AC broke 3 times and had to be replaced once at about 2am .The window in the bathroom was busted and one of the windows was half way out of the frame . The floor in the bathroom smelled of mold and the floor was spongy , my foot went right through it . It was all together dirty too . We had to wait an extra hour to get the room because they were "cleaning" it . There was debris on the floor after the "cleaning" and an extra hours wait for them to do nothing .Dont go here unless you like a dilapidated hotel , if this place wasnt on the Boardwalk it would have been raised long ago .

Reviews.Title: “The Plim Plaza DuMP”
Reviews.Author: JBosco3
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at The PLim Plaza for years. Last year was my last. The rooms were dirty, the staff was rude. The entire week we stayed neither the pool or the jacuzis were cleaned. You could see hair and oils floating on top. Horrible. Lastly we got woken up at 4:00 am in the morning by a fire alarm which was a false fire alarm, but everyone had to be evacuated cause some ex. employee got fired supposedly and wanted to go out with a big bang. You get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and reasonable”
Reviews.Author: kevin a
Reviews.Content: The Plim Plaza Hotel proves each year to be a reliable ,reasonable and comfortable place for us to stay after Labor Day. The building is far from new but well kept and clean with a homey feeling.The staff are polite and positive ,friendly folks and not lazy.The price suits us fine and allows us a nice summer's end vacation spot on the beach and close to everything important offerring a clean and large pool , a nice tiki bar with good live music. There is an"all you can eat restaurant on the lower floor of good quality."Each year my wife and I are very satisfied with the Plim Plaza Hotel. Many people would never be satisfied nor could they under any conditions but to be fair this is a good deal all around.Maybe more money could get you better or a different location but that's always an option.

Reviews.Title: “Legionella Outbreak!”
Reviews.Author: HugsFam
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Plim Plaza Labor Day weekend. Chose this hotel because it is right on the boardwalk and close to the beach. Convenient location but dirty, unkept hotel. Our room had two double beds and was extremely small and smelled of mildew. Very uncomfortable feeling walking into the room; maybe because it was so small; maybe because it had poor air flow? They have three hot tubs and one we noticed had a green foamy substance floating around the edges. All three hot tubs were full of sand. The restaurant was a confusing mess and the food was cold. Our last day there my husband woke up early in the morning extremely sick. Had to leave his vehicle in OC and have a family member pick it up since he was weak and nausiated. Took him to ER twice after our stay. Received three phone messages about unconfirmed legionella outbreak. It has since been confirmed. Apparently this is not the first hotel in OC to have a legionella outbreak; my only advice is to go with your gut feeling when you stay at an unfamiliar place. If it doesn't feel right...leave!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at an older hotel on the boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: Lori E
Reviews.Content: This hotel is older, the halls are worn and the rooms are small but they are kept clean and the staff is very nice. The pool is quite nice and the outdoor bar is a great place to relax with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Kathy W
Reviews.Content: I just spent the weekend at the Plim and was very disappointed. The people were very nice and thank God I did not have to spend alot of time in our room. I spent most of my time on the porch because of the size of the room. I was shocked at the condition of the halls when I got off the elevator on the 4th floor. The hallways were a disgrace. The rugs were filthy and the wallpaper was peeling off the walls. There was no table in the room so if you wanted to sit and have a bite to eat you had to eat on the bed. The bed was horrible. From what I could see of the hot tub from my window they were all rusted. They had three. The pool was nice but it rained the entire weekend so I couldn't swim. It was my first trip to OC and it will be my last trip to the Plim. I was very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “handi-cap friendly with a polite and curtious staff”
Reviews.Author: memehazel
Reviews.Content: Yes, the hotel is old, yes the rooms a smaller than a luxury chain hotel, so are the bathrooms. We have been going to The Plim for over 20 years and are not pleased to read so much negativity about it . I bet you would complain if they tried to hang you with a new rope. We agree with erica2483 from Jersey Shore PA and Brianaaly from Lanham, MD. You get what you pay for. Yes, parking in the hotel parking lot is not always available but you walk out on the boardwalk and to the beach, so why are you complaining about walking a block to park. Sure your vehicle is not close but still a block isn't that far. The rooms are cleaned daily by people that we and other guest trust. They don't move your belongings to make a bed or vacuum, we know this to be true for we have a few pieces of medical equipment and they're not touched. Fact is, the bed is not made if you leave things on it. The staff, what can we say, Jackie, Adam, Jill, Christina, Rick, etc...even Tom the handy man, all are friendly and go out of their way to make your stay as pleasant as possible. I know I have missed some people but they will have to forgive us. Even DAKOTA the bird is a fixture here. So why make other peoples lives miserable because you are unhappy and like to complain, just go to another hotel. I can leave my mobility cart 'plugged in' in the Lobby and not fear anything would happen to it. We now reserve a first floor room because if a storm comes through and the power goes out, I don't have a problem with steps. Yes, even The Plim is in line for Hurricanes, they even felt the earthquake. You gonna complain about that too? We go to Ocean City the last week of August and frequent as many Harrison Group properties as we can. Read on-line to find out where they are located, you may be surprised. SMOKERS BEWARE, if you stay at the big hotel several blocks up the boards, it's over 200 a night and if you're caught or reported for smoking on YOUR balcony, you are fined another 200. Maybe the Plim should enforce this for their non-smoking guest. Erica we are from Mill Hall, your next door neighbor and we agree with you and Brianaaly, The Plim is fine for all of us. The towels and bedding are clean, and so are the bathrooms. Problem--go to the front desk. The house cleaning team deserves praise also, they do a great job of cleaning the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: SendMeUpNorth
Reviews.Content: In a nut shell, this place is a dump. You get what you pay for. I should have known better. In addition to all the negative comments regarding mold, rust, dirty floors, broken windows, disgusting bathrooms, etc. I was violated by the cleaning staff. I brought my own bath towels with me and purposely put them in my suitcase each day so the maids would not take them. WHen I returned to the room I discovered they actually went into my closed suitcase and STOLE my towels. When I called the front desk (from my cell phone as the room phone did not work the entire lentgh of our stay) to complain I was told the maids probably thought they belonged to the hotel and did not want me stealing them! WHAT?? Not once did I receive an apology for the maids violating my privacy and going into my closed suitcase!! When I spoke the the weekend managers they were understanding and did reimburse me for the cost of my towels but I still never received an apology. Needless to say, the maids refused to clean our room the rest of our stay. To make matters worse, I discovered a giant hole (about 2 feet long by 1 foot wide) behind the wallpaper. By this point, all I could do was laugh. I got what I paid for. On a positive note, there is a really nice pool and the band(s) that played in the evening and afternoon were really good.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but great outside ammendities”
Reviews.Author: kimm l
Reviews.Content: It's not doubt that the rooms are VERY small and is in need of being updated, but if you have great weather and don't plan on living in there while on vacation this place is great. Has a big lobby with computer, olympic size swimming pool with tiki bar and great entertainment throughout the day and night along with 3 hottubs. The hotel is in a ideal location on the boardwalk where you can sit on the porch and watch the people walk by or just sit and relax .

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean”
Reviews.Author: TazmanBill
Reviews.Content: Rooms were vere small but clean & the hotel staff was professional & very nice to deal with. bathroom was very tiny. make sure you check before you go we had AA group there & they did nothing but smoke on front porch pool was very nice & hot tubs were also nice.

Reviews.Title: “OMG!!!!!!!!!! talk about dilapidated”
Reviews.Author: jennyarn
Reviews.Content: looks very modern from the outside. but once we entered the building, the smell reminded me of an abandon basement... and the room was the smallest hotel room i have ever ,ever, ever been in my whole entire life. was so disappointed with the condition of our rooms. we had to change rooms b/c the window had no bars, and no lock. traveling with a four yr old that was a super no-no! carpet was filthy- mattress was old and lumpy- i was digusted. pros: staff members were very nice and polite. nothing was stolen from us:)

Reviews.Title: “Great Price & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GhosthunterKim
Reviews.Content: First I must say, that this hotel is very nice, great price & a great location.As soon as you walk in the lobby is huge and very nice it has tables and chairs to sit and eat at, two big screens tv's with lots of very comfortable furniture to sit in. There is also a computer so you use free wi fi. We loved everything about it, the staff, pool, hot tubs, tiki bar. The rooms were small, but we weren't there to spend time in the room. The beds were very comfortable, the bathtub even had it's own jazzuci in it. The swings by the pool were very nice to relax in. The front porch was really nice, we sat there everynight and just watched people walking on the boardwalk. Dakota the hotel bird was so sweet, we most def will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE TEAR THIS PLACE DOWN!!”
Reviews.Author: amith1
Reviews.Content: I just got back from this hotel.....I made them move me from the first room because it was not cleaned- pubic hair all over the bathroom, sand in the bed.....second room- not sure where to start. wallpaper falling off the walls, mold everywhere, rusted lights, carpet is beyond gross and put paper down to walk. I cannot get the smell of mold out of my clothes and luggage I took with me. The hallway is absolutely disgusting with dirty old carpeting that is coming up and is a hazard. The smell of the room was horrible- I kept spraying it with glade to no avail. The chairs in the room were the same ones from when I used to stay there as a teenager.....30 YEARS AGO!! Um....Harrison family.....rip this place down to the ground, start over, and then take a little pride in your properties and MAINTAIN THEM. Your other properties are well on their way to being equally as bad. And the Paul Revere smorgasbord underneath the hotel- beyond gross. people used to wait in line for hours to get in there. no more. we sat there eating watching water pour out of light fixtures and running down a wall. It was actually scary.

Reviews.Title: “Close your eyes when entering your room!”
Reviews.Author: MoDoll
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this site I was very apprehensive about staying here - with good reason. My husband convinced me to give it a try. I'll try to be positive and start with the good. PROS: They have a nice pool and bar area. The pool is really big and the waitresses take good care of you around the pool. It's typical bar food but overall very good. It's also VERY family friendly (which is actually a negative for us with no kids but I can see where it's a positive for others). Even though it clearly stated everywhere not to jump in the pool, the kids are constantly doing it. They also have a very convenient location on the boardwalk. The front porch area was also nice. CONS: THE ROOM - especially the bathroom. Our bathroom had mold on the ceiling. The floor was squishy and so discolored with mold. The mirror had ?rust? spot or some other spots. The heat lamp was very rusted. Overall the room was very old, very small, smelled very must. The carpets in the rooms and hallways are disgusting!!! They haven't been washed in ages (if ever). We asked several times to change rooms (my husband spied some other rooms that were being cleaned that didn't look nearly as bad as ours). The receptionist asked if we wanted to have housekeeping sent up and my husband explained the only thing that would help our room is a total remodel. It's an ok place to stay if you have kids and a very limited budget. If you do stay here, try to get a room on the oceanside - maybe it's better?

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare Room, Stay Away!!!”
Reviews.Author: ThomInSc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were traveling to PA from SC and I decided to treat her to a few days at the beach since she had never been to one above North Carolina. Wanting to stay right on the boards we selected this hotel based on location, price and availability. The lobby, front deck and pool area are not too bad but as for the room (242), we would have better off staying in the car. For starters, the moldy smell was unbelievable and only got worse when we tried to warm the room up so we resigned ourselves to keeping the AC as cold as it would go. The carpet was of the sort where we pretty much wore shoes or at least socks the entire time for fear of putting bare feet on it. Next, as other reviews have pointed out, the closet is worthless for anything longer than tee shirts owing to the mini fridge being located in there. On to the bath room. The shelf as others also pointed out is just a few inches wide and ours leaned forward so that items often fell off. The mirror is located above this and was so high that I could only see my shoulders and above being 5'6" My wife being a little shorter found it absolutely usless. Now for the totally unbelievable part, I am sure we have all been in hotels and even home where the hot and cold faucets have been reversed, but have you ever been in a place where the hot water line was connected to the toilet? Let me say we were not impressed with having our butts steamed when using the toilet and kept the lid closed with a towel draped over it when not in use to try and keep the humidity down. The shower had next to no water pressure but we didn't stay in any longer than we needed to anyway because the bottom of the tub flexed so much we both afraid of falling through. Another really icky item was the black mold ringing the room where the wall met the ceiling as well as a thin black line around the center of the room where it looks like there was mold coming through the wall paper seam. On the way out we were chatting with a customer who said she had stayed there 30 years ago. I asked how it was then and her reply was "the same". To be fair, I had seen the place from the outside many times and certainly was not expecting it to be 5 star resort, but this was crazy bad. I mean Bates Motel bad. Anyone who is giving this 5 stars or claiming this is a great place to stay is either an employee making a bogus review or some college kid who is out partying all night and just needs a place to pass out. Trust me, I have stayed in many, many places and this was the second most icky but that place was only $49 a night, not $159.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in OC”
Reviews.Author: BrianaAlyse
Reviews.Content: First Ide like to say Ive been going to Ocean City for 15 years at least twice every year so Ive had my share of experiences... Me and my 3 friends stayed at the plim plaza for 5 days during beach week. Although we are graduating seniors we definitely have a mature taste in hotels. I was very surprised at how nice and clean the place was. We got there early and they immediately checked us in and had the room and a parking permit ready. There are two sets of elevators and carts to help bring your bags up. Theres also a really nice set of swinging chairs by the pool/bar entrance. Also alot of fully stocked vending snack and bev. machines. So the room was pretty nice. Brand new bathroom with large tub and wide spray shower. Also a mini fridge. In the room we stayed in there were two beds fitting two people in each comfortably. The only thing was that there was no closet or drawrs to put clothes in so we had to live out of our bags, which was OK with us. There wasn't any noise or anything from the bar or boardwalk we slept like baby's. The cleaning service was great..for some reason we'd always run into them in the hall so we just told them if we needed new sheets or more towels. The location was GREAT! Its right on 2ND st. on the boardwalk (by the large gallery store) It was a short walk to the dough roller hooters and other food places and its a closedrive to all the fun places in OC. theres also a large deck with chairs for people watching. During the stay I developed a very soar throat so I tryed out the small coffee stand directly outside of the hotel on the deck. The lady with long dreads who runs it is great :) she knew exactly what I needed for my throat..just tell her what you like/need and she'll have some thing for you! They have two parking lots, the first one is right by the hotel but its veryy cramped (we actually backed up into the wall bc it was so close), the other parking lot is about a block away and is where we left our car the majority of the trip. My over all stay was great and Ill deff be back..ohh yea verryyy affordable between the four of us we each spent about $160 per person for the entire five day stay

Reviews.Title: “I always keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: Suzanimal33
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel for many years and I will keep coming back. We always have alot of fun sitting on the porch with the rocking chairs and people watch. The carribean bar is one of the cheapest to drink at and there is always live music playing.There is a huge pool the only downside was we never can get a lounge chair by the pool..but you always have the ocean. I will keep coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience....EVER!”
Reviews.Author: Blondebeachgirl10
Reviews.Content: I have never in my life stayed in a more disgusting, run down, dirty, hotel before in my life!!! When arriving we drove around the parking lot for 25 minutes trying to find somewhere to park and unload so we could check-in. Only to find out we had to park in a parking lot blocks away from the actual hotel. Then, when we arrived at the parking lot, it was so tight my SUV wouldnt fit, so i eneded up parking in a spot where my car got damaged. Then,every time we needed to get to our car we had to leave 30minutes early just to walk to our vehicle. When checking in,the front desk lady was so miserable. She answered our questions by rolling her eyes and pointing to the piece of paper she handed us with information. Then when we finally got our stuff to our room I was horrified!! The room was filthy! I refused to take my shoes off the whole time I was there. The bathroom had mold, the toilet wouldn't flush, the shower hardly worked, the bed was so filthy I actually drove to walmart to buy my own bedding! The walls were paper thin I could hear every movement going on in the hall way and the rooms next to me. Please save your money and time and DO NOT..I REPEAT DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “OMG, you have to be kidding.”
Reviews.Author: HolmesHolmes
Reviews.Content: Ok, let me first say LOUD AND CLEAR: If your parking lot is BAYSIDE, and you advertise your hotel is OCEAN FRONT, you should have a disclaimer. Listen up folks, imagine trying to get your vacation stuff from your car to your room, when the parking lot is no where near the hotel. Imagine that every time you want to go out for dinner your must HIKE to your car. Enough said? Well, there is more....Apparently this place is loved by old hippies that have been staying here since their glory days and have been reliving their high school senior week for decades upon decades. Otherwise this old hotel would have been torn down. Never mind the dated rooms...after all it is a beach front flop house...How about being woken up in the middle of the night to climb down 5 floors of steps because their fire alarm system shorts out in the middle of the night causing guests to sit around waiting to get back in. During my stay, after waiting 20 minutes on the grounds, tired and grumpy, I called the front desk to ask what was up? They answered that there was indeed a real problem and they were working on it. "really?" I said. "Where are the police and fire engines?" I said. They answered that they weren't sure why the fire department wasn't at the hotel. So I hung up and called them myself. 2 minutes after the fire department arrived, they turned off the alarm and let guests back in. SCARY PART: THE FIRE ALARM SYSTEM WAS APPARENTLY TURNED COMPLETELY OFF. IF THERE HAD BEEN A FIRE LATER THAT NIGHT WE WOULD HAVE DIED. More than one of the guests told me that this is a very common event at the Plim Plaza. Plan to be out on the street at three a.m.

Reviews.Title: “More like Spring Break ...”
Reviews.Author: mmsossy
Reviews.Content: Clean, location great, on boardwalk, however, it seemed more for a college/party type crowd. There wasn't much order at the pool or the Caribbean bar. There were six 20 year old girls next to us at the pool getting drunk- they had no issues getting served and were laughing about it so all around them knew. The pool was packed with people who weren't even staying at the hotel, and there was just a lot of chaos. I wouldn't say don't stay there, however, it's more for those looking for a "spring break" type of atmosphere. There were girls sitting on guys shoulders in the pool playing chicken and guys playing football from one end to the other in the pool with little kids in there and 'no' lifeguards ... An accident waiting to happen. They had a band each night that was so loud it was hard to talk to anyone without screaming. In all honest, I'd say spend the little bit of money and stay somewhere nicer, quieter and better managed.

Reviews.Title: “Burn it to the ground!”
Reviews.Author: squeezll
Reviews.Content: I would describe this as a well located dump. The management must have their act down, as you are beaten over the head with the fact that there are no refunds for any reason upon check in. I soon learned why. I could go on for hours on how this place let me down, but here are the highlights: Immense amounts of mold on the peeling wallcovering, dirty carpets, mold and bug in the bathroom, broken TV...and my favorite...the view. I looked out my window to see a low roof containing smashed glass and a ladder with a rope tied around it and a few beer cans...a few feet away was the next building's wall with a penis spray painted on it. The least I expected was some assistance for the broken TV...just gray snow. The best I was offered was a new remote control. We paid for a 5 star hotel and got an unsanitary hell hole! Without any ability to reclaim the hundreds we paid for the night, we drove to Walmart and bough all new pillows, sheets and bedspread. Jetted in the morning and just had to eat it. The staff had no concern. The hotel got what it wanted from us...our money. The mold though...can someone say health inspector?

Reviews.Title: “30+ years & still booking”
Reviews.Author: blondihi
Reviews.Content: Plim Plaza has always had a family feel. We have a special needs child and I know he is in a safe place year after year. Now my grandchildren come down to the Plim.

Reviews.Title: “PLIM PLAZA REVIEW”
Reviews.Author: Tilt228
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased to say that i enjoyed myself at your hotel. IF you are looking to find a 5 star hotel that is nestled right on the boardwalk where beach and partying is going on. YOU are in the wrong place. IF you are looking for a place that is neat comfortable, staff is friendly and helpful. Pool is a place to relax by, music playing in the back ground, lady bartenders to help you order your favorite drink, talking to a parrot, just relaxing and enjoying the scenery you have made the right stop. This is OCEAN CITY. The fun, the beach, the people watching, the street corner magicians, musicians, and shops. The rooms are a little small. They are clean and comfortable. If you plan on staying in your room, DONT visit OCEAN CITY you are missing what OCEAN CITY is famous for. And dont forget SECRETS, just make a stop, you wont forget the word. Have fun. I will be back to PLIM PLAZA.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: erin41290
Reviews.Content: After booking this hotel and looking at reviews, I was very worried we made a huge mistake. We went in with the lowest expectactions, but was pleasantly surprised with how wonderful our trip was! Yes, the rooms are small and the building is old, so the rooms do smell a little musty but it's nothing you can't deal with. The bathroom is tiny, but clean and the water temps do fluctuate quite a bit but it's a small price to pay for the great location, prices and service. Beds were clean and comfy, they provided brand new fluffy pillows our first day here and the AC is great! We were scared that we would have bad serive since we booked online and others had bad experiences but instead they upgraded our room to an ocean view on the 4th floor and were very welcoming. Room service is extremely friendly and helpful and did everything they could to help us out. Vending machines are CHEAP! $1 soda bottles and waters throughout the hotel and cheap energy drinks and gatorades which came in handy for us. The only complaint I had was that there was really nowhere to hang wet bathing suits and towels to dry. Pool and pool bar are really cute and so much fun. They have poolside service and the carribean bar is such a fun atmosphere. They were very strict about ID-ing, so we didn't have to deal with any obnoxious teens around the pool area. Dakota, the pool bird is an awesome addition and they tested the pool and hot tub levels every few hours. Drinks are awesome, decently priced at $6 for mixed drinks, food is great and bartenders and waitresses are very friendly. We spent the majority of our vacation pool side and couldn't have been happier. You do have to get there before 12 to get a chair though. Location is awesome, smack dab in the middle of the boardwalk. Ocean area is very clean and wasnt too crowded. Parking was 2 blocks down if you couldnt find a spot in the top lot, but you were able to unload and move in before you had to move your car. We left ours parked all week and had no problems. Over all, it was a wonderful trip and we will defintely be going back again next summer!!

Reviews.Title: “We were pleasantly surprised. We will keep coming back.”
Reviews.Author: Oceancityvacationer
Reviews.Content: The rates are great for the quality and location of the hotel. The pool bar was nice and so was the front porch. The location can't be beat. If you are looking for a family friendly place to stay, you have come to the right hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Pool, Great Times”
Reviews.Author: Dee614
Reviews.Content: The Plim is the only hotel that my husband and I stay at. You can't beat the location, the pool, the Caribbean Bar & Grille, and the entertainment. Hotel staff is always pleasant and willing to help. The rooms are standard and sufficient for two adults.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful !!”
Reviews.Author: mlewis1978
Reviews.Content: We loved the pool bar....altho it was hard for us to find a chair, we had to wait for people to get up and leave.....the maid service was good also !!!! rooms were small but for the convenience of the boardwalk and the pool bar....we could'nt complain :) i do wish they had some type of complimentary b-fast....but the apples and bananas were ok !!! we will def be going back there :)

Reviews.Title: “First and last hotel choice in ocean City.”
Reviews.Author: y5nthon5a
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect. The employees are unbelievably nice. They do everything right when you ask for something. The hotel room was the perfect size for 2 teenagers to move around in without a problem. The jacuzzis were put to use many times by my friend and I, which were very enjoyable. The pool is awesome too. Not to mention the 3 restaurants in the plaza, which all serve great food. The bird in the lobby is fun to look at, the view is great. There's people of all ages staying there. The hotel rooms aren't a++ but why the heck would you care about the room if you're just going to sleep in it? Walking around, spending time in other parts of the hotel and Ocean city is what it's all about. I have absolutely no complaints. Most lively hotel in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Has yet to disappoint”
Reviews.Author: redsoxfan25401
Reviews.Content: This was our families 2nd time staying at the Plim and it was even better than the first. We had a oceanfront room on the 5th floor and loved the views an how close you are to everything. Just figured I would review this again since the little gem on the boardwalk gets a bad rap on here. We will be staying here again next year and the year after that

Reviews.Title: “Put your money to better use!!”
Reviews.Author: jessicaann1000
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with family and friends for 4 days, Pros - it's nice from the outside, the pool is big and surrounding area is spacious, the bartenders and staff were nice. Nice live band playing, and the hotel is in a great location right on the boardwalk with a nice back deck. And the beds are actually comfy. Parking was free but ridiculously spaced out, we had to park 3 streets away in a different Plim Plaza lot. Cons - Room is TINY. Ours had 2 double beds with not NEARLY enough space for 4 grown adults to move around. the carpet was gross, it was dirty and their were some sticky spots. the bathroom was very small, and in the jacuzzi tub only 4 out of 6 jets worked. Don't get excited about the outside hot tubs, because only 2 were filled up...they were GROSS and the jets weren't even working until after asking the front desk to turn them on 3 times, they sucked and shut off 2 mins later. Oh and forget about taking a nice shower, the water goes from cold to warm to extremely hot in that order over & over.. I say, use your money else wear to stay but take advantage of the tiki bar.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: brwood3
Reviews.Content: I just got back last week from my stay there. I had no real big problems with my room. It was clean the maids were nice and helpful. I had a room with 2 double beds over looking the pool. Im a freak about the whole bed bug outbreak and i know where to look for them in the matress when they are hiding and id have to say no bed bugs in this room. Thats a PLUS! The lobby was really nice and my daughter loved that bird they have out there! I stayed during senior week( i am not a senior) and there were deff. alot of young kids there but they werent to loud. The price was great for the location. The only bad thing is the parking is like 2 blocks away if you cant get a spot right out back. My jazuzzi bath tub jets were broken but i was not worried about it they have hot tubs right out side! I WILL BE BACK NEXT YEAR!...not during senior wweek!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Very, Very far away from this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dbubbletrousers
Reviews.Content: I went to plim plaza during summer vacation, and i hated it. The rooms are cramped and there were yellow paper towels in the bathtub. Im not kidding. Fortunately the weather was good so we spent as much time as we could outside the room. We asked for a bigger room but instead the person at the front desk looked at us like we had three heads. If you are looking for a nice family vacation at ocean city, this is NOT the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Going on my 20th stay with No Plans on Stopping”
Reviews.Author: xosamanthaxo
Reviews.Content: Next summer will be my 20th year going to the Plim Plaza and I look forward to my stay there every year. It is in the best location on the entire island, right in the middle of the boardwalk! The rides and games are a short walk away along with many resteraunts and shops. The pool bar and pool is amazing and my kids absolutely love the hot tubs riding the elevator. Lol. This is not a five star hotel, so you get what you pay for but I deffinently recommend it to anyone who wants a reasonably priced, amazing vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Worst trip ever!!”
Reviews.Author: jr_314
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend of mine for one week. We walked in and we felt like we were in a jail sell. The rooms were very tiny. We had two single beds and barely enough room to move around. We also found hair in the bathroom and on a clean bed and when we asked for new sheets, both the cleaning ladies and the help at the desk seemed to have an attitude. We were very unhappy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: MomOfRayne
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, I was a little leery based on the negative reviews, but in all, I was satisfied with my stay at the Plim Plaza. The location was great. Located right on the board walk and surrounded by plenty eateries and plenty of shops. I especially enjoyed the patio and pool areas. The staff was friendly and courteous. The only downside, the room had a moldy/musty odor, but we weren’t in the room much for that to bother us. I will be staying at the Plim Plaza during my next visit to Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad.”
Reviews.Author: Hudson1010
Reviews.Content: I was down just last weekend mid aug. And i booked my room before reading reviews, the reviews scared me so bad i wanted to get a refund but i figured ya cant always believe the reviews. The room was small, but it wasnt that bad. i didnt see paint peeling off the walls or anything and the shower sucked it was hot or cold no in between. the a/c was grrreat! i had a good view of the pool and personally i digged the live music playing till 1am. the staff was alittle distorted they made me feel like i had to beg them for help but once u got their attention they were helpful. The floors in the hallway were just out of this world, it was like a rollercoaster ride. This place isnt nearly as bad as others have said, its a place for 2 people at most, no kids. it def is an older place, but experience it for yerself bc the bad reviews completly were way off on this place. oh and if yer looking for the fridge its in the closet. i didnt find it till the nite before i left. cable tv, no wifi unless u wanna pay for it but u can check yer gmail.

Reviews.Title: “New York City prices and location at Ocean City, MD boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: travelolution
Reviews.Content: The plusses were definitely ease of getting to and from the beach without worrying about having to wash off too much. It's a well-traveled and well-lit locations with plenty to do. You can see the ocean from your tiny room, especially if you crane your neck downwards to fit through the open window and take in the ocean breeze! There is a happenin' bar with live band as well as a rowdy crab shack and a dusky all-you-can-eat buffet place all in the same building. You won't be hurting for good people watching here. We knew we were paying a lot for central locale. But given the high rate we did expect the room to not smell of heavily perfumed cleaning detergent. The room always felt a little damp - this may have been due to the oceanfront view. Parking is not bad --- free, but we had to use an overflow lot a few blocks away, so we didn't try to use the car at all during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “MUST SIT SIDE SADDLE ON THE TOILET!”
Reviews.Author: SleeplessInOceanCity
Reviews.Content: Okay folks, paying $184 a night for a 2nd class room was what we expected. BUT, this 9 x 9 room was just ridiculous, a total rip off. This is not as good as 2nd class, maybe ghetto is a better word. Single pane glass, peeling paint, one double UNCOMFORTABLE bed and one single with enough room between the two for a tiny night stand, no chair, no closet, just a tiny pole, no room for legs when sitting on the toilet and that is no exaggeration or lie....side saddle on the toilet for a 5'2" woman, wavey flooring in the halls, loud live band playing until late night.....HELP! FIND ANOTHER PLACE....REALLY!!! Worse place ever. Honestly!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Rooms were filthy”
Reviews.Author: DISAPPOINTEDINOC
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 6 years ago in an oceanfront room. It was great. This year, I stayed in a poolside room and the room was horrible. The lobby was clean. The poolside room, where you couldn't actually see the pool as much as the parking lot, was actually falling apart. As my 13 year old left the tiny bathroom, the vent fell from the ceiling and nearly hit her in the head. The next day, the toilet paper dispenser came out of the wall and left a round 2" hole in the wall. The towel rack is directly above the toilet. We came into the room one time after the "cleaning", and towels and wash clothes were IN the toilet. I had to go down the the front desk and get more. Sand was in the sink and shower before we first entered the room. The bedspread was also dirty upon arrival. The pool didn't close until midnight which means that you couldn't sleep until they shut off the music. The location is great but I will never stay there again. It was so great last time. I can't help but wonder if the cheaper room made a difference or if the place went downhill that fast.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: CharlieGirl1966
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel for many years. But this is unfortunately the last time. The pool is nice but the rooms are horrible!!! They are so run down and dirty!! To pay over $500 for three nights in that dump is insulting.

Reviews.Title: “Found no problems that would interfere with my enjoyment”
Reviews.Author: Snookie39
Reviews.Content: My mother and I went to Ocean City, MD for a short vacation earlier this month. My mother insisted on staying at Plim Plaza because she has fond memories of previous stays there. I'm very picky, so, based on the feedback here, and the fact that Plim Plaza is so old, I was not looking forward to it, and even had a backup plan in case my low expectations were met. I was pleasantly surprised to find that it was clean and comfortable. There were some imperfections - small pieces of caulk missing from the edge of the tub, a small piece broken out of the ceiling, but I've never stayed anywhere that there weren't some imperfections. They were not immediately noticeable, and definitely did not affect my positive perception of our room. The only complaint I had was that some of the employees at the front desk were not particularly pleasant, and appeared to be bored. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Plim Plaza and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: ghosthuntgirl
Reviews.Content: I've read a lot of these reviews and I have to say that this hotel is not The Plaza Hotel in New York but It's not a roach infested hotel either. We have stayed here many years in the past but have always found it clean and the staff very helpful and pleasant. We like the location and the fact that is had a resteraunt and a nice pool. It's true the rooms are small but the way I look at it, how long are you really in the room for? I would reccomend this hotel but not for a large family (there were 3 of us).

Reviews.Title: “Not great but not the worst.”
Reviews.Author: Reymel
Reviews.Content: Was trying to find a place to stay in Ocean City Maryland. Was able to find a vacancy at the last minute at the Plim Plaza. First day we got there we where told that we had pool side. Well im use to pool side but having access to the pool from the room. We had the view of the pool from a window. The rooms are small and the hallways are to. The outside is great and the pool area is nice. Every night they had live entertainment at the bar. When you think about it you really dont spend that much time in the room and the location is great and so is the price. So it was not that bad. We still had a great week.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are small, but all in all its a decent place if your just going to have fun.”
Reviews.Author: PAhene
Reviews.Content: Me and a Buddy of mine went down this year and stayed thursday - tuesday over july 4th, 2010 First off the rooms are small for the price, the room we got was a double bed and a single bed which they listed as a 2 bed room. We almost had a third person coming and we were lucky they didnt come down. The bathroom was tiny, about just enough space for it to be usable. The room also had a musky smell too it, but it was clearly because its an older hotel. Outside of that though, the room was very clean, and didnt look old. I noticed that they gave you full cable access as well, including pay channels at no extra cost, we didnt watch much tv while there but I did notice. The staff was extremely friendly, on July 4th weekend you would expect the opposite because the hotel was extremely busy, down from front desk, to maintenance, to maids, to the service at the pool bar. At one point the pepsi machine outside was giving out the wrong sodas and I told the staff and she kindly refunded me the money and then put a sign outside, its not much but again the manner in which this was done was pleasent, for all she knew I might have been lying. The best feature about the hotel is there pool and outdoor bar area, its huge, their pool is big, as well as their main bar which has a decent selection of food as well, their service was kind and had a fun, happy, attitude. They also had live music every night we were there and over the weekend they had live music from noon to midnight. Most of the bands were very good and they had a wide variety of music played. The pool bar is open to the public as well, but the pool and 3 jacuzzis are hotel guest only and they were extremely good at keeping anyone who wasnt from the hotel out, I was actually amazed at how well they were doing recognizing who they had to confirm as a guest. Their is also a buffet restaurant the Paul Revere in the lower level of hotel that is pretty good, and for only $13 a adult, I beleive it was only open early afternoon till the evening but it was extremely busy but they did well getting people in and out. There was another restaurant bar on the boardwalk side of the building but I am not sure if its part of the hotel itself. But that is 3 choices to eat immediately accessible to eat right from your hotel. They also have a smoothie bar on the boardwalk side, as well as a large sitting area on the boardwalk, you can drink out there as well if you want because it is still part of the hotel. Its also probably one of the best areas and hotel to watch the fire works from during 4th of July. Last the parrot, Dakoda, makes for a little entertainment when he is in the lobby or around the pool bar area. Sometimes he'll greet you. All and all if you are looking for a decently priced hotel, arent traveling with that many people, want to be on the boardwalk, arent going to spend too much time in your room, I would recomend this place. Dont expect 5 star rooms but you can expect to have a good time at your hotel while enjoying OcMd. I would recommend this for: Young and Middle Aged Adults Couples who arent picky Teens People traveling solo One last thing their bartenders are HOT! lol *The pictures linked were taken by me, Percy Ahene... you can find me on fb!

Reviews.Title: “exellent for the price”
Reviews.Author: brooklyn_06
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the plim plaza from 6/30 to 7/2 and we had a blast. the location is great. ive seen on here where people has complained of the rooms and halls smelling. my room didnt smell but the halls smelled a little musky but what can you expect in an old building. the rooms could use a little fixing up . its has an excellant ocean view. another thing they could change is their front desk. the one lady was not people friendly at all.

Reviews.Title: “This was a mistake”
Reviews.Author: Birdy2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Plim for a weekend with our two young boys. The first "non-smoking" room they provided us stank of cigarette smoke. After a call to the front desk a maid came up to spray the carpet and open a window. Then my husband demanded we be moved to a real non-smoking room which was done without any issue. The room we were moved to was not really acceptable for the price, but we were only staying for two nights so we decided to suck it up. I would echo what many others have said about the condition of the rooms. They are simply too small and very run-down. I don't think renovations will do much to help the situation. I would recommend demolition. If there is one nice thing I can say it's about the staff. They were never rude and they were helpful enough.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID PLIM PLAZA AT ALL COSTS”
Reviews.Author: geoffrey_atkinso
Reviews.Content: "Non smoking" rooms reek of smoke. Moldy walls, wall paper peeling off. Hallways stink of mildew. Tiny rooms. Bad beds. Carpet is so gross you will want to wear flip flops at all times. Loud teenagers running around all night long. Band playing at pool bar until 1AM. VERY OVER PRICED!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and in need of some attention!”
Reviews.Author: WakeyWake
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband & 5 month old daughter for 1 night in June as we were making our way from New York to Virginia Beach. We booked last minute and as the hotel was on the beach we thought it was worth a try! The desk staff tried to charge us an extra $60 despite the fact we had paid in full at booking, our room was tiny with 2 double beds squeezed in, there was so much damp that the wallpaper was coming off around the windows - and was being held on my drawing pins! The room was so grotty I kept my daughter in bed with us rather than put her in (our own) travel cot on the floor! It was overpriced for the condition of the hotel, despite having a good location directly on the beach. If they just spend a bit of time and money raising the standard of the hotel I'm sure they could charge even more, and be justified! I would not recommend this hotel to families with small children or those looking for a quiet or romantic getaway. It would probably be ok for a group of young people looking to party at the beach and only needing somewhere to sleep (but would really be overpriced for that!).

Reviews.Title: “It was a love hate relationship with the Plim”
Reviews.Author: janie061
Reviews.Content: Me and my adult daughter stayed the first week in June. Hated the false fire alarms in the middle of the night, not once but twice! We had to go outside in our pj's down from the 5th floor. At least the alarm system works. They moved us to the lobby the next day. Our room was small but clean. Awesome location! Great coffee shop on the porch, wooden rockers, a huge pool, live music. Right on the boardwalk! Had to park in the next block for most of the stay. We didn't spend much time in the room, pretty much just slept and changed cloths and showered. I would stay again because of the cheap price and great location.

Reviews.Title: “I have a soft spot for this place...and will never stay again.”
Reviews.Author: CSC1979
Reviews.Content: It has been almost two years since I stayed there, but I recently found the pics my friends and I took of the place, so I thought I would post our review. Plus, we still talk about the grossness. I spent my summers in college working at Paul Revere's below The Plim, as we affectionately called it. If anyone would look for the silver lining in this place, it is me. I just cannot find it, though. The place was DISGUSTING. I went in 2008 with my three girlfriends. A the time, we were in our late 20's and our hotel standards were pretty low. All we wanted was a clean place to crash at night. When we first walked to our room, the smell of the place was overwhelming. We felt like we were back in college. The halls smelled stale and so many of the guests left their doors wide open while they lounged around the rooms. I know this is no fault of the hotel, but it was just...weird.
