We could look in and see people still in bed in their undies! Our room - WOW! The wallpaper was coming off. There were stains all over the place - the mattresses, carpeting, walls, ceiling. It was disgusting. None of us walked in our bare feet. We had to brush our teeth in the tub because the sink would clog up and would not drain for hours. We were even apprehensive about taking showers there because the shower was just so gross. I know we went out a few nights with our sunscreen still on from the day because it just wasn't worth it to shower. You felt dirtier afterwards. We did buy some Lysol and clean the room ourselves the best that we could (door knobs, light switches, TV remote, alarm clock, etc.) and put up the sign asking housekeeping to not come in. You may find this extreme, but it was THAT bad. We did enjoy the staff at the desk, but we also struck up conversations with them about people we knew from our days at the Smorg (Paul Revere's). They were very sweet to us. We also LOVE the pool bar. The four of us spent many hours lounging by the pool, drinking froofy drinks and having good conversation. The location IS prime right there on 2nd and Boards. Unfortunately, the location and the pool bar, which is open to the public, are not enough for me to ever take my family there. I'd take the bus over staying at the Plim. Also, please keep in mind that this place is NOT cheap and it is suppose to be good for families. Had I been there with my husband and son, we most definitely would have left. Luckily, my girlfriends and I were able to joke about it.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: sbobodalka
Reviews.Content: I have seen better hotels that rent by the hour. The staff at the front desk are the most rude and unfriendly bunch of people that i have ever seen in my life. The room is so dirty I was afraid to take off my shoes that I might catch something.The people that are writing good reviews about this place are obviously family or owners. I am staying this weekend I would definitely recommend someone touring the actual room you are going to stay in before you pay for it..

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Bemyhollyw00d
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I wanted to go away for memorial day weekend, and the photos were very decieving. They showed very nice but basic rooms. Upon checking in the staff was very rude to all the guests and rude. Once you got into the room it got worse. The roof was caving in, there were holes in the wall, the bathtub was rusting/chipping, the remote didn't work and the saddest part was the tv was the nicest thing in the room. We came here to relax and thought about leaving the same day we checked in cause we couldn't relax. Beware of this hotel, and I'm using that term liberally. The best thing is the pool and we couldn't enjoy that cause it was surrounded by drunken idiots, one jaccuzi had no water, another was too hot and the last was freezing. I do not recommend staying here at all.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room for a night or two.”
Reviews.Author: Leah M
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here last September for a night just to get away. The rooms need a bit of updating, but they aren't as horrible as the reviews might suggest. Yes, they are VERY small, but clean. Neither of us noticed bugs or mold. We had a pool-side room which was a bit noisy on a Friday night, but if you're exhausted from being in the sun all day like we were, you don't really care. Don't come here thinking you're getting a Holiday Inn or Hilton. It's NOT. If you aren't concerned about all the bells and whistles and just want a place to crash after the beach or boardwalk, this is the place to go. I'm staying here again this summer, and would recommend it for a night or two. Location is FANTASTIC.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the bad reviews. Just go, it's a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Madi05
Reviews.Content: I just felt the need to comment after all these people left rude and untrue comments about the Plim Plaza Hotel in Ocean City Maryland. I have stayed at this hotel every year for the past 6 years. It is a lovely hotel (of course, not the Hilton or anything) located right on the boardwalk. Don't believe the people leaving ridiculous comments about this place. They are full of crap. Go and enjoy : )

Reviews.Title: “The Absolute Worst Hotel I've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: roadtrip008
Reviews.Content: What a dump! I booked this over the phone - big mistake. I asked for a ocean front view, but was told all I could get was one with a view of the pool. You could see the pool if you stood on the edge of the (filthy) tub and looked out the little twelve inch window. We should have known to turn around when we first walked in. The place smells like mold. There was a parrot in a cage in the lobby, crapping on to a bedsheet. The fixtures in the room were all pained over to hide the rust. Avoid this place if you can. Sleeping in your car is a better alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Very unfriendly front desk staff at this old and musty moldy place”
Reviews.Author: behtah2
Reviews.Content: Well, we have been staying at the Plim Plaza for five summers in a row now. I think we're finally done. The front desk staff are always, always rude and not friendly at all!!!!! Never!! The rooms are very old and musty. This past summer we actually had bed bugs. Gross!!!! The hotel staff acted like we were lying and didn't offer to do anything about it. I itched all night. Even squashed a few I saw running around the bed. The mattresses are terrible and the pillows are so so flat. I'd rather sleep in my car. The only plus about this place is the awesome pool and front porch and the parrot in the lobby. Dakota is great! I also like the location. I really wish this place would close down and do a total renovation. I would stay again if they did. Also, get better staff!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! When you check in or out, they act like you are bothering them. This always made me feel uncomfortable to be there. Please, please, please spend some money to renovate this once great place and hire nicer staff. Please!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “My kind of place....Plim Plaza is.....”
Reviews.Author: ez_steve
Reviews.Content: this was a fantastic place to hang out at the beach..... sure...it's old.....but hey it's right on the boardwalk.....just a few yards from the beach.... with a really large front porch....that's filled with oversized rocking chairs...... ...great place to watch the sunrise... ......also it gives you ring side seats for people watching..... ...or watching "Randy Hoffman" sculpt some of the best sand scultures you'll ever see .......right in front of the hotel !! now ......let's go around back... they have an oversized pool... .....with live music and a Tiki bar.....even a side area with hot tubs surrounded by palm trees as you can tell......i spent most of my time outside of the room so keep in mind.... this is an old hotel....with constant beach and pool traffic... the staff keeps it as fresh and clean as possible.... my shower and bed worked perfect...... i come to the ocean...for the ocean....this place is perfect for me

Reviews.Title: “Believe the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: Nascargrl3
Reviews.Content: From the outside the hotel looks fantastic. The lobby looks nice. It's the room that begins the nightmare. I've never been in such a dirty room in my life. The wallpaper is falling off the walls. There is wiring stapled around the ceiling. Mold everywhere. I attatched pictures as proof. The toilet was literally falling through the floor. The floor was so saturated that the flooring became weak, like you were standing on a sponge. The floors were crooked. There was a mens and ladies room next to our room, when you walked out of the room there was a strong odor of urine. The outdoor bands played on the backside of our room so sleeping wasn't an option. There is also a no money back return policy and it was bike week so we were stuck with the room or go home. Parking was 2 blocks away. What a hassle hauling your luggage.

Reviews.Title: “I definitely will stay here again. The accommodations were great.”
Reviews.Author: rlhawk594
Reviews.Content: While it rained everyday we were there, the hotel was great. We especially give credit to Delores and Daniel who helped us considerably. The lobby was very nice with fresh coffee and fruit every day. We did not have the opportunity to visit the pool or sit on the great front porch because of the rain, but both were clean and nice. I read reviews before I booked our room. Some people were not very nice in their comments. I think they must have stayed somewhere else. Every room is gradually being remodeled. I look forward to next year when I can stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, old, small, and smelly! Spend a little more on a nicer hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ChristeeM
Reviews.Content: Let me just say i will never ever be staying at plim plaza ever again! where do i even begin? First, we arrived at the hotel and my initial thoughts of the outside was that this must be a nice hotel because it looks pretty nice outside. boy was i wrong do not be fooled by the outside looks the inside is totally different it was very old and smelly. we got our room key for 550 and the elevator is very slow the hallways were so old and smelled like mold almost the ceiling has missing pieces and dripped water. our room was HORRIBLE! VERY SMALL and old, the carpets had white and black stains, it smelled of mold, the wallpaper was coming off in many spots, the bathroom was so tiny i could barely move around, the sink reminded me of a kids play house sink which was located UNDER a ledge on the small mirror at a 90 degree angle, the shower was dirty , the shower curtains had holes in them, water pressure was very low, there was a DEAD BUG on the hair dryer cord, and we were poolside near the bar and it was VERY loud every night until 11:30 pm. we asked the front desk the first night if we could upgrade to a bigger perhaps better room and the man there said sure we can the next morning well morning comes and we ask the front desk person do you have any oceanfront rooms we can upgrade to? and it was a woman this time who immediately said no without checking!!! These people are not service friendly at all! we also checked out one of the other rooms and i was in complete shock to see that the bathroom floor tiles were missing and moldy wood was present. The ONLY good things about this place is the location and free parking. Overall this hotel is GROSS!

Reviews.Title: “"Worst Vacation ever"”
Reviews.Author: DRTRPENNSYLVANIA
Reviews.Content: Well where should I begin?? Let me start by saying that I have been coming to Ocean City, MD for the last 15 years & I have NEVER experienced anything like this place!! The rooms are so small that there is not even a place to put your suit case & did I mention the black mold that we enjoyed staring at the whole time. By the 2nd day of the vacation the wall paper was peeling off the wall & my 5 year old was waking up coughing & not well at all! When we addressed it to the staff it was like a joke!! We stayed 5 days & the pool was never cleaned. There was a couple that had sexual relations in the jacuzzi's & if you are looking for a spot at the pool good luck because the pool bar is accessible to all of Ocean City with no questions asked by staff. Please take my word for it that this place is not worth a penny & avoid it at all costs. I would never want anyone to have to go through what we did!!! Almost forgot to add that the parking lot was 2 blocks away from the hotel .

Reviews.Title: “The Plim Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Nickel1971
Reviews.Content: Just like everyone else we read the horrible reviews! We stayed there last year, but were really nervous after reading the reviews. I took my mom, daughter, and her friend. The room was REALLY clean (515), GREAT housekeeping (Ruth), friendly staff, good food, fun location, and coffee stand on front porch (FANTASTIC). We will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “I loved the PLIM”
Reviews.Author: mystical1721
Reviews.Content: Like everyone else I read all of those reviews (literally) and I must say I was scared to stay at the PLIM. However, I think all those people might be whack jobs because I had a lovely stay. Yes, the rooms were a little smaller than what I have stayed in, but that was no problem at all for me and my boyfriend. The rooms were clean and smelled just fine. I had no mold or anything crazy like that growing in the bathroom (not like all the previous post had said). I had a pool side view room, and loved it. I can look at the window and see the 3 hot tubs (which was extremly clean and refreshing)...and the huge pool. I loved the tiki bar and the live entertainment all night. I even had a nice view of the ocean from my room !!! The only thing that looked yuckie was the hall ways to your room. It needs a paint job and new carpet but besides that its just a hall way..no biggie. And the service we had there was excellent no complaints and nothing stolen I guess thats a good sign !!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Good Service”
Reviews.Author: bp122663
Reviews.Content: After I booked this weekend I went on to review some of the reviews and was expecting the worst possible senario. When we arrived I was pleasantly surprised. We were actually able to check in 4 hours early. In addition our room was very clean especially the bathroom. My family doesnt generally stay in the hotel much during vacations so the smallness did not bother us. We did enjoy the bar and pool area and found many other vacationers did as well. Come on folks were do you expect to get quality music and bands for free these days. The bar prices were reasonable as well, our teenagers could actually enjoy the music and could sit by the pool. This hotel's selling point is its location and ease to the boardwalk. Give it a shot you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice clean hotel!! We Will Be Back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Zip21
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed here in room 410..the room service everyday was wonderfull, rooms we'r always clean, maids were verry nice and helpfull. The room we stayed in was verry nice for 4 people a clean bath, chairs to sit on, a little fridge, phone that works, and Color TV, 3 hot tubs and a verry nice pool..The pool had bits of sand at the bottom here and there but kids we' r also coming over from the ocean and jumping in...the bar wasgreat good food and a nice show was put on every night. We could look out our window early in the morning and see the staff cleaning the hot tubs and pools so they were clean...The hotel had a beuatiful big porch to sit on when ever you pleased.therewas two elivators one new and verry nnice, the other one was a little slower but it was just old. stairs and hall ways were kinda small..but they where also redoing alot of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump- Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: MHusk
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I recently stayed at the Plim Plaza- what a dump! While the pool and bar were nice ammenity, and the location was awesome on the boardwalk, this hotel is super dirty, smelly, and downright disgusting. I would NOT go back or recommend a friend. The pool had a lot of "stuff" floating in it, the rooms were tiny and musty. The front desk staff was rude and unhelpful. Trust me, I've stayed in OC, MD many times and I know the motels are NOT 4 star resorts. However, this one sucks. Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Will not be returning”
Reviews.Author: Mustlovefood14
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel a few days before we were scheduled to go to Ocean City. The photos on the website made the hotel appear to be decent. Boy was I mistaken. The one thing I will say is that the hotel is in a wonderful location and the pool area is also very nice. The pool included a bar that you can actually get waited on while you lay out which I thought was pretty neat. It gets packed early so it can be difficult to get a spot. We checked in and even tho they said our room was ready they would've give us our keys until 11 (It was around 10:40 at this point). I was extremely disappointed when we entered the lobby. The lobby as well as the hallways smelled like dirt and mold. To be honest I was afraid to touch anything. Our room was extremely small which wouldn't have been that big of a deal if it was atleast nice. The carpet is NASTY!!! Who knows what has been on it. The wallpaper in the hotel is peeling off the walls and you had to sit sideways on the toilet because your knees would hit the tub. I wouldn't say that I am hard to please but the least they could do is spray some airfreshner in the hallways and room. Next time I will pay the extra 20 dollars a night to get a nicer place that I'm not worried I'm going to catch some disease in. I will NOT be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but clean”
Reviews.Author: bboomer55
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights July 20-24th I was very hesitant about staying here after some of the neg reviews but after staying there I have to say some travelers expect way too much for their money. We have been to OC 3 times. All the chain hotels are pretty much the same down there, Most beach hotels have sand and mildew smell, because of their location. You could easily pay $200 or more for a room a night but, I don't see them as being much better. besides the rooms some what larger. It took a day to adjus tbecause the hotel is old and the rooms are small and do need some TLC such as wallpaper loosening,but are clean The hallway was quite long and narrow , but after the 1st day you get used to it. Our room was cleaned efficently and we treated the staff nicely and in return we were treated the same way. We had to park at another lot but it took a total of 3 minutes to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Keep looking”
Reviews.Author: OlneyGuy
Reviews.Content: By far, the nastiest hotel room I have ever stayed in. I can handle a small room, but not a closet with 2 beds and a tv. You couldn't open the door all the way because you would hit a piece of furniture. They would not swich our room or give us a refund. I would have GLADLY taken half my money back just to be able to leave. Thank god we had good weather and could avoid the room. Since returning, I have been threatening my kids with going back to Plim Plaza if they don't behave . . . . enough said

Reviews.Title: “Decent Room, Super Location”
Reviews.Author: Sn0wSeeker
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 307, ocean front. The bill for two nights came to about 400 bucks, including taxes, etc. Our room had one double and one single bed. The room was in decent condition. It was pretty clean. Great view of the beach and ocean. The bathroom had been remodeled within the last several years, apparently, so it was fine. The room was largely taken up by the beds. We didn't care because we left in the morning for the beach and then went out at night. The weather was spectacular all weekend long. The air conditioner, TV, and small fridge worked great. We made our reservations just 48 hours before we checked in, so we had to stay on the smoking floor. However, our room really didn't smell bad. And we brought a scented candle, as reviewers below recommended, as well as our own towels. The staff was very responsive and friendly all weekend. The pool is incredible, but it does get packed if you get there in the afternoon. There are two poolside bars with food and the hotel had really good bands playing poolside till 11PM both nights. Frankly, you really don't need to leave the hotel for food and entertainment. There are two restaurants on site, including the "Mug & Mallet." But we nonetheless walked just a few blocks to the bayside Marina Deck restaurant for lunch one day and dinner another day. The hotel's location makes it very easy to get to great places to eat, dance, etc. The Plim Plaza has a terrific front deck with comfortable chairs. Great for people watching. The hotel lobby was very clean and comfortable, with complimentary coffee all day. I think it had WIFI too. And you only walk about 20 feet from the hotel to hit the beach. The beach was crowded, but great fun. All in all, we had a wonderful time at the Plim Plaza. We are going back in October during the hotel's 'customer appreciation' week, and basically staying for free. That's a deal the hotel offers if you stay with them at any time during the summer season. Another bargain weekend !!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER EVER STAY HERE I MEAN EVER!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TPORTILLO301
Reviews.Content: This weekend I had the worst hotel expeirence of my life! First of all the hotel was dirty, smelled like mold and mildew! The rooms were so small and in the bathroom, the wallpaper was coming off the wall, ants were all over the place, the shower was extra small and the toliet was leaking from the base. The management was not helpfull they would not give us a refund, and would not change our room. Parking also is a problem, there is really no parking there at the hotel you have to park 3blocks away. Just wanted to warn as many people as possible about this place, I got sick I have a upper respitory infection after staying there one night , it was because of the filth!!! NEVER STAY HERE NEVER EVER!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: onefamdad
Reviews.Content: Looking for a way to take our 3 Children and my wife to the beach for a few days that wouldn't break the bank.... Plim Plaza was it. We arrived early on a Tuesday morning and they had onsite parking for us that we could use BEFORE we checked in. They offerred us the ability to use their changing room on the 3rd floor so we could go to the beach - again BEFORE we checked in. After we changed we walked out the door onto the boardwalk and then right on to the beach. The room was clean and comfortable - the AC was cold and worked well maintaining temp. The room was "dated" but I was looking for VALUE. The pool and Tiki Bar are fantastic! We drank coffee by the pool each morning and ended up back at the Tiki bar each evening for a beverage. The hotel is a very busy place - Yet they try to do ANYTHING to accomodate their guests. We had a great visit and will go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: jennay121
Reviews.Content: For the price and location, this hotel is definitely worth it. Yeah the rooms were small, but we spent all our time at the beach or poolside. The hotel pool and 3 hot tubs are a really nice feature. The rooms and hallways didn't smell like mold at all and seemed quite clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. Only downside was having to park 2 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “DONT STAY JUST TO SAVE A FEW BCUKS”
Reviews.Author: beanie1dubois
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the plim plaza for two years now, so I knew what I was getting, and since we dont spend much time in the room, I figured "what the heck"..........WEELLL, first room this year was the absolute worst thing I have ever seen, Where to begin, the walls and shower curtain were covered in mold, the head board fell off when my friend got into her bed, the shower bottom was literally a piece of contact paper with a hole in the middle for the drain............(so bad we wore flip flops to shower) AND it wasnt even big enough to turn around in..................AND WAS FILTHY!!!! Bathroom light was COVERED in pure rust................got another room that was better..............but after being home a day I developed a horrible red itchy rash, and so did the friend I went with,,,,,,,,,,,,we both went to the Dr who told us that we had been bitten by BED BUGS!!!!!! I called the hotel, sent the physician statement, yet they are not taking responsibility for this. I know I got them there, first because my friend who stayed with me there did two, and second because my husband whom I sleep with every night who didnt go on the trip doesnt have them.......they would not compensate me in any way whatsoever!!! I have pictures of the rash, and the room that we stayed in and I am sending all to the MD board of health...............PLEASE BEWARE!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location,Tiny rooms, Good service,”
Reviews.Author: caeckard
Reviews.Content: We've been to Plim Plaza several times now. Rooms are cramped, mattresses not the best esp with the crinkle of plastic still rustling. Too many double beds not enough queen/king. If you want more space try for a communicating room for not much more cost. Fridge is an expected but still appreciated touch. Bathroom was much updated from last one we were in. Cleaning was hit&mis with some days better than others but staff willing to do whatever asked. Smell is musty and old but then it's an old motel at the beach-like another said, bring a candle. Fridge, TV, A/C, etc all worked. Besides the rooms &hallways, the rest of the hotel is open, clean and airy. Attractive expansive lobby with tables and comfy furniture for lounging, eating, watching (2)tv or gathering with other guests. Drawing card for us is the long porch and deck full of rocking chairs facing the boardwalk for sun or rain. Parking area is free, cramped & usually filled but 2 blocks away they have overflow and we never had any trouble there. This trip showed signs of some renovations. Staff was always helpful and friendly but could get short when busy. All 3 hottubs were down our first day but were fixed & filled same day and then like before quickly filled with kids. I think it should be parent required so more adults could actually use them. Pool always seemed clean and inviting, expect kid play. Caribbean rooftop outside bar has friendly fun staff, good sandwich/snack fare and drinks with a terrific variety of entertainment on weekends, which is how we first discovered the place while staying elsewhere. The bird gets moved around to its perch near the bar or inside lobby but has never been agressive unless someone is stupid enough to try to touch and even then it pecks and stops, not attacking. Lobby has microwave, coffee/tea available 24/7. Ask @desk for hot choc. No continental breakfast which was surprising. The Phillips buffet is dark inside, reasonable priced $13apprx but like most buffets variety is offset with bland taste. Desserts were good. Mug&Mallet has more variety and good food reasonable price. Plentiful restaurants of all tastes/price ranges within driving or walking range-ask at the desk they're very helpful. Also, there appears to be 'regulars' that have been going there for decades who also regroup after Labor Day for a greatly reduced 2nd season trip price of Guest Appreciation Days. They're more than willing to share the best/cheapest/etc eating places around town. In summary, It's an older place and the rooms size and oldness are its worst features but still ok. You don't need to stay in the room-even if grounded by weather the porch and lobby are available. The rest is updated, clean, open and nice. If still in doubt check the website for the virtual tours- the room they show is corner, ocean view, one bed-imagine two beds in that space and if you can handle that the rest is uphill.

Reviews.Title: “The Plim Plaza is fine! You can NOT beat the location and value!”
Reviews.Author: mew0359
Reviews.Content: After seeing all the negative reviews, I felt I had to submit my unbiased reveiew. We have stayed at the Plim Plaza for summer vacations several years in a row. The Plim Plaza is an older Hotel, right on the beach and boardwalk. The location is fantastic. The Boardwalk is right there and you can walk to everything. From the Oceanfront rooms you can see the religious sand sculptures on the beach. The Plim Plaza is the ONLY Boardwalk Hotel that I know of where you can get an oceanfront room in July or August for under $200 that has a Pool, hot tubs, Pool bar and daily/nightly entertainment. Sure, the rooms are small, but what are you going to Ocean City for??? To sit in a Hotel room day and night?? The Pool bar is great and somewhat of a night spot for the younger crowd. I have dined at the Paul Revere Buffet Restaurant and found it to be fine. There is also another Restaurant called The Mug and Mallet. The Gourmet Coffee Bar located on the porch is great, but it should be open longer. The big wide porch is so nice in the morning, sipping some hot coffee and watching the sunrise. (For all you early risers!) As for the Parrot in the lobby, if you are dumb enough to stick your fingers/arm in a cage, then you deserve anything you get! In conclusion, the Plim Plaza is not the Hilton on 32nd Street, but a decent Hotel that doesn't break the budget. It does not deserve such negative reviews.

Reviews.Title: “watch the bird in the lobby”
Reviews.Author: tlc2116
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at plim plaza,it was very nice had a great time but there was one bad thing that went wrong the bird they have in the lobby who they allso let out in the bar area bit my arm and drew blood someone was taking pictures and i got a copy of what the bird did to me.My arm still hurts im tring to get intouch with the manager of the motel so i can send him a copy of the picture i have .So I'll keep you informened of what happenes .Toni From Maryland

Reviews.Title: “what a dump”
Reviews.Author: hammertimehi
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed at a place so gross. We went there with our 3 children and would not allow them to take their shoes off in the room. The first room we were given smelled like smoke (non smoking room by the way) so we switched to a different room and it smelled like garbage. The room was extremely small. The mirror was cracked in the bathroom, the bathtub was filthy, the window in the bathroom would not close so we heard the noise from the boardwalk all night long. The shower was freezing cold and then switched to burning hot so my kids cried the whole time they took showers. The comforter had blood stains and burn marks on it. We could not open the window to get any fresh air in the room because we were afraid the kids were going to fall out. The hallway was filthy, the pool area was full of locals. We actually left a day early because we could not stay there any longer. We will most certainly not be going back there next year. I think any place would have been better than the Plim Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “is this it?”
Reviews.Author: etchasketch9
Reviews.Content: It was my sons and mine vacation here and we have stayed in a wide range of hotels and motels in the last couple of years. This was something new, Nice wide windows opening up to a stucko wall, but if you moved to the side enough you could see the beach. The room was very tiny, I asked for two beds just to make sure we had a big room. It wasn't big at all. Very damp, everything was damp. Smell wasn't so bad, lol. Bring a candle. you get what you pay for right, but for this price you should get more. Upside was the pool, bar and front rocking chairs very nice. Way to give the customers a treat for thier stay. One thing would be at the pool, guests should come first then who ever walks in to snag all the chairs and be rude(locals). Yes we had to park a couple of blocks away but that was after the hotel workers helped and took our bags to our room. Truck never left that parking lot the whole time. awesome thought huh? Everything was close.

Reviews.Title: “We prepared for the worse and It wasn't so bad”
Reviews.Author: WestVirginiaLadybug
Reviews.Content: We had an Ocean front Queen room. The room was small, the bed was terrible but the view was awesome. I took a plug in air freshner to help the smell. I suggest you do the same. Parking was very limited and the 20 minute unloading spots had cars in them they didn't move the entire time we were there. The pool was nice until Saturday when folks rolled in that weren't guests of the hotel. At noon it was standing room only and the pool was really crowded. There was a group of people standing in the pool by the stairs drinking, swearing, humping the girls they were with and several other gestures not appropriate for children or the other guests for that matter. These folks were in street clothes and I feel like something should have been said to them. There is a sign at the Tiki bar that says the pool is for guests only. What a joke! People were walking in all afternoon and using the pool and lounge chairs that were not staying there. We heard a couple complaining that had a 7 yr old girl that left. I understand things are going to be a different, after all it's a pool bar. But there is no room for the guests that put up with the short comings of the hotel to enjoy the pool and now you can't even enjoy that for all of the locals and people walking in off the street. My husband and I went on to the beach and enjoyed the ocean. We came back around 5pm thinking the crowd would thin out and it had so we decided to go for a swim. Then someone pointed out there was feces in the pool. Several people took a dive down to view the turd and confirmed it was indeed poop. I observed a couple of people that made a waitress and the guy with the straw hat that handles the bird and cleans up around the pool aware of the feces in the pool. The straw hat guy left and did nothing. The waitress thought it was funny and told other staff members which also got a laugh. Needless to say we didn't take a swim. We finished our drink and went on our way. The front desk staff were very nice. We will go back for the location and hopefully next year if enough people complain they will restrict the pool and lounge chairs for the guests. That sign hotel guests only past this point is a real sore subject with us. This is not a family friendly hotel when they allow people to conduct themselves the way they did in the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool Bar”
Reviews.Author: msanders-TRIP
Reviews.Content: The Plim is definitely not for the faint at heart. It's true the old girl needs some TLC and a good scrubbing but there is an upside. Location, location, location! From our OC front room, we overlooked the sand sculptures, which were beautiful. The staff were all very nice, the bartenders friendly. The Caribbean Pool bar is great and the Plim is a convenient walk to the pier, inlet and MR Ducks tiki bar.

Reviews.Title: “If it smells like trash, it must be trash”
Reviews.Author: LoraPa_
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from four days at the Plim Plaza. The hotel is neglected, dirty, dark, dated, and we have never experienced such conditions before. The hallway to our room reaped of an odor like raw sewage, the room itself was small, the bathroom had mold, grime, and dirt. The sink basin backed up each time one washed their hands. It was so disgusting that it was hard to drag ourselves back to the hotel each evening to sleep. The pool is great but neglected. Excessive unremoved sand, black grime around the pools edge, and bugs actually swim in the pool along side you. Overall I would say this is probably one the worst hotels we have ever stayed at........

Reviews.Title: “what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: philaleronaldo
Reviews.Content: what every 1 says we have stayed there 2 times in 4 years before trying myrtle beach s.c ( but now with gas and the long drive from phila,pa plus you have to stay at hotel on the trip to s.c both ways what costs even more) so we r going back to plim. funny we see in the statements the same things we noticed. the smell,mold, cracked/spores on ceilings, small dirty rooms, dirty bathrooms, no space in bathroom or for your clothing. but pool,deck ,outside bar,location and price make it a deal compared to other hotels we have priced(almost double the rates. beach is right on top of you. you can watch your kids from front room window. plus the paul buffet is right next door. as is a lot of attractions. so as others have stated if you dont plan to stay your entire vacation inside room a good place to stay. but if a could find a hotel in area with a cheaper rate i would not lie to you and go there

Reviews.Title: “Live music by the pool”
Reviews.Author: sfree809
Reviews.Content: Only good for between Memorial and Labor Day. At that time the outside jacuzzi's and pool are open. They have an outdoor bar -restaurant right by the pool that plays live music midday to midnight. Like the Beatles, Neil Young, ... So the kids get to swin and I get to hear live music. I would not pick this place though out of season-the rooms are small and the walls - ceilings thin-but for the summer I love it because of the pool/jacuzzi/music-and in the summer who stays in their room at the ocean anyway? Also the birds in the cages inside and outside are a nice amusement for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad”
Reviews.Author: HJBDelaware
Reviews.Content: I read some of the reviews before my family and I left for OC and was really worried we were going to stay at a complete dive. I wasn't expecting a 5 star resort; the room was really cheap, on the boardwalk, and on 2nd street. The hotel is old and the hallways could use some tlc. Our room was completely renovated and clean, yes it was small but we aren't going to live there. The room was also very quiet and the staff was very courteous. I never went to the bar or the pool so I don't know what they were like. Hope this review is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: sissy220
Reviews.Content: The lobby and the pool area are nice but that's it. The rooms are disgusting. There are stains on the walls, the air conditioner was falling apart and loud. The bath room...wow the bathroom.. the bathroom is moldy, the bath tub is stained and when you're standing in the shower you feel like you're on a boogie board. I'm not sure if there is water traped under the shower but you are woobleing back and forth the entire time you're taking a shower, not to mention the temperature was constanly changing. Needless to say I took a shower with the flip flops on. The toilet was stained as well and I'm pretty sure they don't clean or change the shower curtain. For as much as we paid we should have had a much better room., but I don't think they have any. The beds weren't much better, I can't believe I even slept in it. I should have slept in the car, I would have felt cleaner. I highly recommand you DON'T stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Plim hard to beat for the money”
Reviews.Author: SinkyDave
Reviews.Content: I read many of the reviews on this site for the Plim and went ahead and spent the week there. It was a great week! I parked my car at check-in and didn't move it until we checked out, Everything I could have wanted was within walking distance. The pool was clean and yes the cool water was a shock, but it was great. The hotel staff was great, very friendly and courteous, I just wish someone would learn how to make coffee for the lobby. As the reviews state, it was the worst in the entire City. Thankfully a Dunkin' Donuts (open 24 hrs) is a short walk north on the Boardwalk. The Carribean Bar by the pool has food and drinks, and the lovely wait staff is happy to bring them right to your lounge chair. The room was clean. It was small, but who wants to stay in their room when you come to Ocean City? It is an old building and is being constantly upgraded. If you want to stay in a snortzie joint and be pampered and have to tip everyone you see, you are not gonna be happy at the Plim. If you want a decent place to stay at a reasonable price, be right on the boardwalk, enjoy a great pool and the ocean, enjoy a drink served by some of the best looking waitresses in OC, stay at the Plim, you won't be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Dump”
Reviews.Author: Flowerkittyj
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing but a dump. The rooms are in horrible condition, small and dirty. I was very disgusted because they let the locals in who are very trashy sort of people, cursing loudly shouting at the band like a texas roadhouse. I was waiting for bottle throwing toward the band. The bartender let the locals do what ever they want. There is a Macaw parrot where the locals where handling it roughly under the influence, the Plim Plaza workers has no control over the locals because they continue to get out of control while people were they with there small children. They really shoud stop letting the local in. People are paying good money to bring their families there and relax not to hear cursing and yelling. Do they realize there in Maryland not Texas. Do not recommend this place for you family. Go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Plim Plaza Is A Good "Beach Hotel" Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cSherry
Reviews.Content: Went for the OFF SHORE BOAT RACES in June and stayed in a Beach front room and the view was AWSOME!! BEACH, POOL, BOARDWALK, great beach hotel! GREAT LOCATION on BOARDWALK close to everything. I only went to the beach did NOT go in the POOL. I did NOT try the RESTAURANT. If you like SEAFOOD go to "PHILLIPS" best food ever, (all you can eat) CRAB CAKES are THE BEST! If you like Nightlife "SECRETS" is the place to go, on the water, (bayside) Indoor/Outdoor NIGHT CLUB - TIKI BAR - PALM TREES - SAND- BANDS -DJ, great place to go so much FUN!! OCEAN CITY IS SO MUCH FUN FOR EVERYONE!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Plim”
Reviews.Author: loveangel616
Reviews.Content: I have been to this hotel every year since I was 19, I'm now 27. Yes the rooms are small, and i admit they aren't in the best of shape. But unless you plan to spend the whole vacation in the room you really don't even notice. My husband and I bring our 5 year old son, and the room is fine for three people, we have plenty of room to move around. As for the price, you are paying for a hotel right on the boardwalk. Its a nice little hotel that is right in the middle of all the action. Anyone that wants more than that, just has unrealistic expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: twotoedsloth
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Plim Plaza hotel several times in my life, with family and most recently, with my boyfriend. If you're looking to stay in your room and have all the comforts of home, this is definitely not the place for you, but if you are looking to spend time on the beach, seeing the sights, or in the pool, like we were, this is a great place to stay. Gorgeous pool with pool bar (and live music most every night) and hot tubs, all on an elevated deck so you don't have to deal with boardwalk noise. Location is great, right in the middle of the busy part of the boardwalk, lots of food and entertainment close by. The only problem I have ever found with this hotel was that if there's no parking in the small lot under the pool deck, the overflow lot is a couple of blocks away, which is annoying. There's usually ample space to stop your car and unload all your luggage though. The rooms are small (we've only ever gotten the cheapest one though) but if that works for you, I'd highly recommend the Plim Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “One word "yikes"”
Reviews.Author: Pudge6
Reviews.Content: I USE THIS STORY WITH EVERYONE I MEET AS THE WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE EVER! My husband and I hardly ever get away for a vacation. I convinced him that we needed a week of sun and fun. I didn't tell him how much I had paid for this room until we got to the hotel. They charged our credit card and we went upstairs. When I saw how small and ragged the room was, I cried and finally confessed how much I had paid. He was livid. We sent our two daughters to the beach so we could scout out the area and see if anything else was available for the week. One block north we found The Monte Carlo. It was like heaven compared to the Plim Plaza and the price per night was about $40 less. Went back to the Plim and demanded that they refund our money. Best move I ever made. Still could hear the loud music until about 2am from our new room a block away but luckily the walls were fairly soundproof. You decide, we thought it was horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't pay me to stay there...”
Reviews.Author: martink18
Reviews.Content: My friends & I booked 2 rooms at the Plim Plaza for a fun little weekend get away. I should have known that we were going to have troubles with it upon arrival.... For starters we got down there probably about 7pm and had to park the whole way across the street... like we had to cross 2 main roads to get back to the hotel. Once we got in there, they gave us the keys & told us where to go. We started heading back a hall way that (no joke) got narrower & narrower as we headed back. My friends room was before mine so they went in... HORRIBLE smell. So we thought we would try my room out. Open the door to find a triangle shaped room with NO window except for a tiny window in the bathroom. Our room smelt HORRIBLE. The bathroom was tiny & smelt like crabs. I gagged when we opened the bathroom door. I always bring a bottle of air freshener with me no matter where we are staying & the whole bottle didn't even touch the horrible smell of the rooms. No lie. Our "mini fridges" were in the closets. What a place for them... that tells you how small the rooms were. When we were in our rooms we could hear the band playing in the bar. It was so loud. No one would have been able to get any sleep. The ONLY good thing about this hotel is the fact that they gave us a full refund when we complained. I wouldn't recommend my worst enemy staying at this place. Yeah the prices are decent but wouldn't you rather pay a little bit more & have walking room?

Reviews.Title: “kajon on the beach”
Reviews.Author: kajon1127
Reviews.Content: could not beat the price,about half off any other hotel checked,the rooms may be a little smaller than average but i dont know about any body else but i went to spend time on the beach not in the room, and i must mention the location just steps outside the door to amusements, food and of course the beach ,all wraped up in a very reasonable price going again next year

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time”
Reviews.Author: MrsMPa
Reviews.Content: We stayed there during bike weekend. We were married on the beach right in front of the hotel, it was perfect. The other guests gave us a standing ovation after returning from the ceremony. Everyone was so friendly. The location was close to everything. Housekeeping was very friendly and did their jobs. The sand sculptures on the beach right in front of the lobby were very nice. Our rooms were clean and neat. The rooms weren't too big but they were fine. I'm sure you could find things to complain about, but if your looking for a nice reasonable place to stay this is it. We had read some of the reviews and were concerned. Needless though, we would stay there again. The price was great . The birds kept the kids entertained, for the short times we were in and out of the lobby. The only real complaint we could have is that there is not enough on site parking. Mr & Mrs M

Reviews.Title: “Nice place on a budget -close to everything”
Reviews.Author: TerGood
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the PLIM PLAZA in Sept 2007 - best we ever had - true the rooms are small but compared to the price - location - hugh pool - FREE Coffe & tea & fruit - love the real live parrot -hugh porch to sit at - 2 large lobby TV's - CLEAN ROOMS - MAID SERVICE every day - if you need anything - go to the front desk - taken care of right away - central located to everything - including the art sand work - FREE you will NEVER find all that for low price in Sept. - the rooms are big enough to do what u have to do - who stays in your room at the pool or beach - if you want a larger room - stay at the RITZ- Clarion or one of those high rise hotels and pay the out rangous price -- then you will have something to compalin about after they rip you off with the high prices - this PLIM PLAZA was the best - we will go back again in Sept.

Reviews.Title: “HATED the LIL' plim plaza hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicikola
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the this hotel for about 2 hours. The room was very small,the carpet in the room was wet and the so called jacuzzi tub didn't work at all. My husband called to the front desk and we pack up and left. This little hotel is not for someone that wants to enjoy hotel stay too. Plim Plaza hotel does not give REFUNDS!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Weekend well spent”
Reviews.Author: lisamarie322
Reviews.Content: The Plim...My home away from home. My family and I have been going there since 1986...The hotel is in a great location to the Beach, Boardwalk, Inlet, and Bay...They can only do so much in a years time...they are always redoing the place...once you finish it's time to start all over again. The lobby is huge...TV's To watch...The pool and the Pool Bar are tops...It really shouldn't matter where you stay...you are at the beach for the beach...not to live in your room. The staff is awesome. Very friendly, helpful, will do their best to make you feel at home...

Reviews.Title: “Not for families with small children”
Reviews.Author: MarylandBeachgirl
Reviews.Content: Our hotel stay was paid for by someone else, so we probably looked at it from a different perspective. We didn't pay for it, so we didn't mind as much. Had I paid, I'd have been dissapointed. The first problem with this hotel is the parking. They say it has four parking lots on the web site, but they don't tell you the other three are a couple blocks away and you have to cross the busy highway. The parking that is right at the building is very limited and on a first come first serve basis. You can pull up and drop off your luggage, but you have to wait in line and it's very cramped. It's very inconvenient that your car is two or more blocks away from the hotel. With the rooms being smaller than normal, there is no room for beach chairs or surf boards in your room. Who wants to walk two blocks each way before and after they go to the beach with beach gear. Ocean City streets are not a thrill to cross any way. The hallways in this hotel are in need of new wallpaper and are very musty with carpet stains. If you didn't go any farther than the hall, you would swear this hotel was a dump. Thankfully the rooms are better than the halls. The hotel room is small. It's the smallest i've ever been in. It would be ok for a couple, but we had our two children with us and it was to close of quarters for four days. Granted, you may spend a lot of time out on the beach or shopping, but if it rains your in for a long haul if you have to be cramped up in one of these rooms. The room was clean, but not clean enough that you would feel comfortable without shoes on your feet. This was hard for us because we had a three year old who kept trying to sit on the floor. The wallpaper was torn in some spots and very dingy. The bathroom looked very clean. I have seen other reviews that said the maid service was poor, but it was very good for us. The building is made of wood and I wasn't real comfortable knowing that if it caught fire it would go up quickly. The rooms have no balconies so if the hall is blocked by fire on an upper floor you'd be toast. The pool and bar area is nice but no one is there to keep pool goers under control. The water was also freezing cold. I'm not being picky either. You know when its to cold enough that the kids don't want to stay in......it's pretty cold. We did not try the hot tubs because they were always crowded. The lobby is very nice and we all enjoyed the birds. They even have a talking parrot that was a blast to listen to. The porch area is nice with rocking chairs for watching the boardwalk. All in all, I would only stay at this hotel if it were paid for by someone else, a party of no more than two per room, and it was no longer than a four day weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: JayZomb
Reviews.Content: Not bad! Yes this hotel is old! The rooms are very small. The price is great and it is clean! When going to the beach do you need anything else?? Nice place ok service. I will be going back next year!

Reviews.Title: “The Plim will please the right travelers”
Reviews.Author: Riverview6067
Reviews.Content: There seems to be no middle of the road when it comes to reviews from travelers who have stayed at the Plim. You either love it for what it is or you hate it because you invisioned something totally different than what you experienced. I have stayed at the Plim for many years dating back to the mid 80's. I dont stay at the Plim for it's poshness. I stay there because it represents an excellent value for what you need at the beach. I emphasize need, not want. The Oceanfront location is superb if you want to be right at ground 0 as it relates to the amount of stuff you can do at the beach. Front deck is welcoming and relaxing. The pool is huge for being in the city. Poolside tikibar/grill service, Need I say any more?. Live entertainment daily. Rooms are a little smallish and the Hotel has a little age on it. It is one of the oldest on the beach besides the Atlantic Hotel which is ancient. Periodic remodelings keep it fresh though. I like to think that staying at the Plim is like deluxe camping. You have good ac, tv, shower, bathroom and room services. Complimentary daily newspaper, fruit, coffee and tea. If you came to the beach to impress your friends with your hotel room, you may want to pick another hotel. If you would rather spend the money you saved by staying at the Plim on having a good time with your friends and dont need to be coddled in Marriott style luxuries,then The Plim will please.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Beachlover044
Reviews.Content: The plim plaza was great, the rooms are not as small as everyone makes them out to be, and keep in mind the great price you pay. Certainly you're not expecting the ritz. All in all a great value. Putting up with a small room was the least of my worries. My kids and I had a great time at the pool and we're moments away from the beach. "The Plim" also provdied a very secure atmosphere, requiring "key cards" to get on every floor and work the elevators. I must say that the Plim is well worth the money and a great spot to bring the little ones.

Reviews.Title: “Tiki Pool Bar is the only redeeming Quality of this Shoebox hotel”
Reviews.Author: icechik74
Reviews.Content: This hotel is way overpriced for what you are getting. The rooms are the tiniest I've ever seen and I wouldn't recommend it for anyone aside from maybe a "Senior Week" crowd who will party too hard to care. I remember walking down the hallway, which actually dropped off under the carpet (almost broke my ankle)... thinking it was one of the seediest places I've ever been. Our room was beyond small. We had a double and a twin bed crammed into a very small space. Our shower was running the entire time, & there was no ventilation. My friend even had prescription medication missing from her suitcase (pills missing out of the bottle) after the maid service. The one plus - and the place we spent most of our time was the pool and tiki bar. They had yummy carribean style drinks and it was a fun atmosphere, with summer entertainment (Jimmy Buffett type performer). I might come back to have a drink at the bar, but wouldn't stay here again. It's admittedly hard to find a decent room in Ocean City, but this place is definitely on my "NO" list.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at the Plim Plaza”
Reviews.Author: Boo10
Reviews.Content: My son goes to Sunfest every year, staying at the Plim Plaza. We decided to go this year, and were not disappointed. Yes, the rooms are quite small, but so is the price. For us that works because we spend little more than sleep time in the room. Everything worked well, the A/C, plumbing, TV. Room was clean, service fine. They are apparently restoring the rooms area-by-area. Anyone wanting the room cleaned early in the day has only to put the tag outside the door requesting service. We appreciated fresh fruit in the morning, and coffee and tea all day. The large tri-level ocean-front deck was a delight, watching the sunrise early, the action later. A huge, reasonable buffet restaurant downstairs was also convenient. Theirs is the largest hotel pool I've ever seen, but I can't comment because it was too cool to get in. Lots and lots of pool-side lounge chairs. The Plim Plaza's location is good, a do-able walk to the amusements, bay sightseeing boats, and the Sunfest activities, yet far enough not to be caught in the congestion.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms to small”
Reviews.Author: pamouselover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the plim plaza for three nights in Aug. 2006. Two adults and two children ages 13 and 9. The plim plaza is not a bad hotel, just the rooms are way to small for a family even of four. We had a oceanfornt room, but there is only windows no balconies. There is no table or chairs to sit and even eat breakfast at in the room. A small space to hang clothes over the ref. and not enough space for clothes in the draws. In the bathroom we had a jazzuzi tub. The bathroom is not to big either. The room on our leaving day was leaking water either from the air, or celing. We could not tell. Pool was clean. Hot tubs looked dirty, but I did see that they change the water every day. Some people had their babies in the hot tubs and small children. Which I found strange. We like the location but would not stay here due to the small room, and the price we thought was too high for such a small room. We did paul rev. smorbsburg under the hotel for dinner!
